181001.name: View-Master Piramido
181001.description:
Use one of the reels included to build the pyramid. Start at the base of the pyramid and reach the top to pick up a key to the underground labyrinth. Each player uses a reel to find their starting space and the path they have to take to get to the top. They use the dice to move to each space shown on the reels. The sphinxes can be placed to delay the players - needing to roll the number on the back of the sphinx to pass.

The winner is the one who has completed the route in the correct way, and if there is more than one who has done this, the one who arrived first.

181002.name: The Maverick's Space & Fantasy Gamer's Guide
rpg: The Adventures of Indiana Jones Role-Playing Game
Star Trek: The Role Playing Game (FASA)
181002.description:
From Cover
A reference book for players and collectors of classic sci-fi/fantasy boardgames, microgames, RPG's, miniatures, and gaming magazines of the 1980's including: Fantasy Gamer, VIP of Gaming, Space Gamer, Interplay, Nexus, Ares

User Summary
A massive and exhaustive index of every issue of several important periodicals of the 1970s, 80s, and 90s. Includes front matter, complete magazine listings, alphabetical article index (with six special topic headings), and eight appendices of special groupings including author index and magazine games. If an article or author or game supplement appeared in Ares, Fantasy Gamer, Interplay, Nexus, Space Gamer, Space Gamer/Fantasy Gamer, or The VIP of Gaming, you will be able to find the issue and page (and concise biographical data) about it in this impressive and complete index.

Games listed in this RPGG entry represent those systems that have multiple/significant entries in the index. Unlisted games may well be covered as well. Note the index does not include gaming articles, etc.--it is an index to published periodicals.

Publisher Description
The Space and Fantasy Gamer's Guide is a 500 page index listing all of the boardgame and RPG related articles printed in the game magazines Space Gamer, Fantasy Gamer, Nexus, Ares, Interplay and The VIP of Gaming during the 1970's and 1980's. Article entries include information such as the title of the article, author, brief explanatory comments, and a general classification of the subject matter using over 20 categories (such as designer's notes, interview, capsule review, feature review, variants, strategy, errata, scenario, etc.)

Article Index: Over 4000 articles have been indexed and organized by game name and subject. Seven appendices cover non-game related articles such as book reviews, film reviews, video games, computer games, fiction, and play-by-mail games. An author index helps you track down articles by your favorite gamers. There is also a bonus index describing the magazine games published in these magazines.

Magazine Listings: The Guide contains an issue by issue publishing summary for each magazine. These summaries list the featured article for each issue as well as notable changes in staff or format. The recurring columns and features from each magazine are also briefly described.

The Gamer's Guide is an indispensable resource for game players and collectors who are searching for variants, scenarios, and errata for classic games. The format of the Guide allows it to be conveniently used for browsing or research purposes.

181004.description:
9 promo cards.

5 Law Cards - Unification Policy, Peace Treaty, Trade Agreement, Labor Reform, and Secret Combinations
4 Character Cards (all with the same ability)

Note: These are the same Viceroy promo cards that were offered by the Dice Tower Kickstarter campaign
181004.name: Viceroy Promo Cards

181005.description:
From the publisher:

On September 6th and 7th 1914, at the First Battle of the Marne, 600 Parisian taxis requisitioned by order of General Gallieni gather at the Invalides. The objective of this unprecedented military maneuver is to send quickly a reinforcement of 4000 men of an infantry brigade. As a lieutenant in charge of logistics, you cooperate to embark soldiers and organize convoys. You have a great responsibility: face the challenge without giving up to the pressure of taxis that accumulate!

"The taxis of the Marne" is cooperative card game. On a player turn, a new taxi arrives at the Invalides square and then the players plays 3 actions out of the 4 possible actions:

Mobilize soldiers (drawing a solder card)
Move an officer
Exchange (swap a card with an another player, or with the deck on solo mode)
Load and send a taxi




The game ends when all taxis have been sent or when the Invalides square is completely surrounded by unsent taxis.
181005.name: Les taxis de la Marne

181006.description:
War Returns to Europe: Yugoslavia 1991 (WRTE) is a simulation of the first engagements of the Yugoslav Wars of 1991-2001. Game play begins in June 1991 when Slovenia and Croatia proclaimed independence from the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, and ends in early 1992.

There are two players in WRTE: The Federalist player and the Separatist player. The Federalist player assumes the role of the commander of the People’s Army of Yugoslavia (JNA), the only Federal institution still working in Yugoslavia in the early 1990s (the Federalist player must fight low morale, politicos, and the Separatists to keep Yugoslavia united, or at least to retain the largest possible tract of Serb-inhabited territory). The Separatist player represents the governments of the breakaway republics of Slovenia and Croatia fighting for independence and a free market economy.
181006.name: War Returns to Europe: Yugoslavia 1991

181007.name: Cthulhus Ruf (Issue 7 - May 2015)
181007.description:
(user summary)
table of contents

Editorial
Die Vereinsseite: Die Deutsche Lovecraft Gesellschaft - on the publisher
Die Flüstertüte
Libertalia - a location for Cthulhu pirates
Katzenglück - a scenario for Cathulhu
Der Club der Witwen - a scenario for Cthulhu 1920s
Das Feuer des Prometheus - a scenario for Cthulhu 1920s
Lady of the door - a location fpr Cthulhu Gaslight
Märchenhandel - from the keeper's archives
Mythos Schach - on chess and Cthulhu
Lokis Kinder - a tale of Terror in three epochs
NPC of this issue

181008.name: Cthulhus Ruf Archiv (Issue 7 - May 2015): 1001
181008.description:
(user summary)
This issue of the archives comes with the regular issue 7.
It deals with "Geschichten aus 1001 Nacht" (Tales of the Arabian Nights) and Cthulhu.

181009.name: BowTilz!
181009.description:
BowTilz! is a fun new tile-matching game. Players nest tiles along 4 curved edges by matching colors.

Quick and easy to play with a nice challenge curve as players become more strategic in their game play.

BowTilz! can be played 18, 72 or 136 tiles, the more tiles the more strategy advance players can employ. Players are rewarded by receiving extra points and turns for matches tiles on multiple edges.

Great game for 2 players, also great for more - 2 players with the 18 tile set, up to 10 players with the 72 tile set, and up to 19 players with the 136 tile set.

181010.name: The Discovery Game
181010.description:
The Discovery Game is designed to be played by a married couple. It creates an atmosphere of exhilaration, where a couple can experience something similar to those initial "falling in love" feelings. During this process, true intimacy is developed and deepened. That being said, the game is also competitive; the couple competes one against the other as they both enjoy the benefits of their new-found intimacy. It is simply a great date night in a box— accessible anytime and anywhere— no costs, no distractions, no preparations, no planning.

The Discovery Game is effective for the newlywed, the empty-nester, for couples that are very close and those who are struggling. This is possible because the couple controls the content and the pace of intimacy. The discovery game simply provides the environment and the parameters necessary for a great date to take place. Consequently, the game provides the perfect environment for a connected couple seeking an exciting night of physical intimacy, while also providing the perfect environment for a couple hoping to re-establish friendly lines of communication.

The game is a Focus on the Family "Reviewed" product. It has also received endorsements from FamilyLife, The American Association of Christian Counselors and Shaunti Feldhahn (the best-selling author of "For Men Only and For Women Only").

In that there are property spaces one may purchase, and because the Reality Check spaces often impart financial setbacks similar to those encountered in real life, The discovery Game is sometimes said to be similar to Monopoly and the Game of Life. The discover Game is different from those games in that it was designed to generate intimacy in a relationship. To that end, the discovery spaces are among the most important spaces on the board. For when a player lands on a discovery space he or she draws a discovery card. The cards prompt the player to several types of actions— all of which promote intimacy. The discovery Game is also unlike many adult board games which are purposed on inducing sexual intercourse. Sexual intercourse is often the outcome for many couples as they play, and The discovery Game does encourage mild physical intimacy and hugs, it is never coercive. Sexual intimacy that is spawned by The discovery Game is always the free choice of the players— as a couple— and the natural result of emotional intimacy.

Spaces unique to the game are:

The "Wish Space" (when a player lands on this space, using the included sand-timer, he or she must perform the wishes of his or her partner for two minutes. These wishes might be sexual in nature, but they might also involve household chores— It is always up to the players and the actions must be mutually consensual).
The “Center Square” (is a jackpot where monies from the players are directed at various points in the game. If a player enters the Center Square and rolls doubles, he or she acquires all of the money in the jackpot. If a player cannot roll doubles he or she can use his or her “Get Out of Center” card. If he or she has already used that card, the player may exit the Center Square by removing an article of clothing (socks, shoes, shirt, it is the players choice). A player can enter and exit this space from any Reality Check or discovery space on the board, and the Reality Check and discovery spaces are located all around the board. This makes the Center Square an extremely helpful way of navigating the board.




One of the greatest things about The Discovery Game is, no one feels like they are working on their marriage! It's just fun! This is a tool that has been used by thousands of strong and struggling marriages alike, to move them toward passion. It normally takes at least an hour to complete. However, because much of the game is dependent on the discussions which ensue from the discovery cards, the discussions themselves determine the time it takes to play the game.

181011.name: Der Schatz des Käpt'n Flint
181011.description:
Generations of seafarers have spent their time searching for the fabled treasure, but none have managed to find it. But now Flint's old chart has turned up, on which the hiding places are marked. Multiple pirate ships simultaneously reach the island group in which the treasure chests are hidden. But the restless ghost of Flint is guarding the treasure. Who will be successful and recover the most valuable treasure chest?

Game contents: 1 board (included in the magazine, showing 7 spots with 3 to 5 treasure chests on an island), 8 small and 8 large markers in two colors (not included).

The starting player plays with 8 large and 5 small markers, the other one with 8 small and 5 large markers. Players alternate taking turns placing their markers on the spots, never identically repeating the opponent's move. The game ends when both players placed all their 13 markers on the 7 spots of the island. The 7 spots are scored one after each other; at each spot the player with more markers (or in case of equal numbers, more large markers) wins; in case of a tie no one gets the treasure chests. The player with the most treasure chests found wins.

181012.name: Dead Drop
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
181012.description:
Scenario'

The team are independent security contractors based in Eastern Europe. They occasionally fulfil some discrete, under the counter security work for the local United States Embassy based within that country.

In this scenario, the team are asked to locate a diplomatic aide and his embassy car. The team find the aide dead, with another corpse in the trunk of the car.

181013.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 1 - Nov 2013)
rpgissuearticle: A Moment with Debby and Olaf
PBM is Dead, Long Live PBM
Phoenix: Beyond the Stellar Empire - Here and Now
To Boldly Go, Now in Public Beta
181013.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 1 - November 2013
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181014.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 2 - Dec 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Exploration, Expansion, Exploitation, and Extermination for Extremists
Interview: Bill Heron of Nova Games
Reflecting on the Musings of PBM Personalities
A Yuletide Carol in the Theme of Phoenix
181014.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 2 - December 2013
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181015.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 3 - Jan 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Everything You Need to Know About Damage
How I Found Myself in Hyboria
The Changing Face of PBM - A Decade On
181015.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 3 - January 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181017.name: Winston-Salem
181017.description: This Monopoly knock off from the early 1980's features local properties such as K&W Cafeteria and WXII Channel 12. 2-6 players go around the board in this roll-and-move game buying properties in hopes of being the last player standing.

181018.name: Dispatcher
181018.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

The game takes place in the near future on a spaceship called Dispatcher, whose crew is trapped with alien monsters after an accident.

181019.name: After The End: The Harvest
181019.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Humanity has all but disappeared from its original planet and home, with only its remnants remaining scattered.
Those who were not worthy, did not graduate the cycle.
By chance encounter with an intelligent being, you begin your journey to unravel the great mystery of the universe itself.
There is no one way to reach the finish. Players are almost immediately left to explore at their own leisure.

Features:
Huge Open World Set In Space
Action RPG Combat
Lootable Enviroments Including Planets, Moons, Derelict Spacestations, Monster Infested Asteroids & More
Control And Navigate Your Very Own Spaceship
Constant Danger: Enemies Get Stronger The More You Play
Crafting Hunting & Scavenging Mechanics
Non-Linear Questing: Go About Your Adventure In Almost Any Way You Desire
Huge Open Environments Filled With Unique Characters To Interact With, Items To Find, Monsters To Hunt & History To Explore
Spacesuit With Boost Jump: Enables You To Breathe In Space
Summons: Gigantic Monsters Which Aid You In Battle
Mouse & Keyboard Support (JoyToKey Controller Compatible)
Heaps Of Enemies And Bosses
Arena Challenges
Hidden Areas
Plenty Of Side Quests With Interesting Characters, Rewards And Outcomes
Planetary Day/Night Cycles
Unique Planetary Climate Systems
Different Monsters/Quests Depending On Time Of Day
Planets With Villages, Quests, Items & Monsters
Heaps Of Choices For Weapons And Magic
and much more!

Source: The Publisher Website.

181020.name: SECTOR
181020.description:
User Summary

SECTOR is a shooter where you play Dimitri, a scientists who made a failed biological infected enemy.

181021.name: RAKE
181021.description:
User Summary

You play as Gordon Davis, a cryptologist.

181022.name: Primeval Thule Traveler's Guide
181022.description:
Publisher blurb:

Inspired by the literary traditions of sword-and-sorcery adventure, lost worlds, and fantastic horror, the land of Primeval Thule is a savage, intense campaign setting. This is a world of barbarian freebooters and dark magic, star-spawned monstrosities and elder gods, fabulous treasures and mind-blasting terror. The Primeval Thule Traveler's Guide is the introductory chapter of the actual Campaign Setting book, and provides an overview of the setting.

181024.name: The Gatherer of Nightmares
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
181024.description:
The Hook

The Player Characters are asked by Lord Wharton to determine the source of young Lord DuCaine's sudden physical and mental dissolution.

181025.name: A Peculiar Pentad
181025.description:
From publisher blurb:

Help Is Here ... For A Price

It's a lonely life investigating grisly affairs and confronting unnamable horrors, and it requires all sorts of materials that can't be bought at the corner store as well as information that isn't found in mass-market publications. Sometimes it seems like an investigator is all on his or her own, with no one to turn to for advice, assistance, or just fairly-priced goods of a specific nature. But if you wander down the right back alley, you may be surprised what you find.

A Peculiar Pentad presents five shops that every investigator may want, or need, to visit-a rare book store where the proprietor quotes from texts that were supposedly lost to the ages; a repair shop whose owner can get any mechanical device, no matter where or when it was made, functioning as good as new-probably better; a private social club that caters to those who have seen things no human ever should, and more.

Written by a quintet of fan-favorite and award-winning game designers including Jeff Grubb, Gwendolyn F.M. Kestrel, Jeff Quick, John D. Rateliff, and Thomas M. Reid, A Peculiar Pentad - Savaged! is the latest in a continuing series of sourcebooks designed to provide resources and inspiration to Realms of Cthulhu players and Game Masters alike.

181026.name: AR-K
181026.description:
Alicia Van Volish is a former cop which is trying to be a journalist. She has a terrible hangover… what happened last night? And the most important question… What is that sphere?

Help Alicia and enjoy the 4 episodes of this classic point and click adventure. You will love it. Discover the world of AR-K and their charismatic characters!

Source: The Game Website.

181027.name: Fists 'n' Throttles
181027.description:
From the back of the box

Five game compilation featuring many of the top games from '87 and '88. Features fighting action from Thundercats, Ikari Warriors, more coin-op fighting action from Dragon's Lair, and race track action on both two wheels and four with Enduro Racer and Buggy Boy.

181028.name: Never Alone: Foxtales
181028.description:
User Summary

A new folktale about a kid and a fox who fail to respect the smallest of creatures, a mouse, and end up having to face their biggest fears.

181029.name: Game of Thrones - Episode 5: A Nest of Vipers
videogameseries: Game of Thrones - A TellTale Game Series
181029.description:
User Summary

The actions of every Forrester are vital to the survival of the house. Rodrik’s alliance with House Glenmore, and his defiance of the Whitehills, has drawn the ire of an even greater threat: Ramsay Snow.

181031.name: Sweet Spot
181031.description:
Take it to the courts with your trusty racket as you battle it out in an intense tennis game. Sweet Spot is a tactical card game that sees players take on the role of a tennis pro battling it out in intense singles or doubles matches.

There are three types of decks in the game: Service, Return and Tactic. Players have to play the right card at the right situation as they rally it out on the court. But beware — stamina management is a critical part of the game! If you are not careful enough, you might end up breathless too quickly.

Sweet Spot uses a uniquely designed 'numbers system' to simulate the tennis ball's position and allows players to feel a realistic strength control of their swings where they can literally hit the ball lightly or drive it down hard. Powerful Tactic cards can tilt the balance and are at the same time highly thematic - Bench allows one to regain more stamina in between rallies, Crowd Cheering allows one to perform better at critical moments and Egg Shot hits the ball so high in the sky that the opponent cannot take an accurate read on its position when it comes down.

The game features more than eight characters with unique character abilities, and over thirty different famous moves in the tennis world. It also adds an additional layer of intensity with its hidden card mechanism that will keep players on their toes as they try to predict whether a ball was given a spin or not, and even then, whether it was a topspin or an underspin...

181034.name: Pirates Fantasy Island
181034.description:
Translated from the publisher:
An old Pirate locked in prison who must whisper to his apprentice on the outside the pieces of the treasure map. A team game,

It's no issue to simulate ambient noise, the poor quality of telephone communication, .. On the one hand we'll put two teams in the competition (which will happen to find his treasure in first... and then it will create an emulation.. a sense of urgency, like a crisis situation). And in addition, we will impose, round after round, a way to communication even further (sorry.. pas could help..), such as talking with your hand in front of your mouth, or like a ventriloquist...

To take into account the possibility of being wrong because different terrain typess, near the treasure the different areas of the treasure map will bear the name of beaches... all different beaches, but with similar pronouniations. (Oracabech Playa, Ocarabess Palia, Oracabess Playa etc etc...).

Finally, to follow the paths on the reconstituted map with your finger... These paths are almost impossible to follow with the naked eye... Indeed, they have green dotted amid the lush greenery in orange red tones... On the other hand, when we place the small red filter of transparent plastic on the map and push it with our finger, flora disappears, leaving the path that must be followed...

The most interesting part of this game, it is that, in explanation, we are told only the rules of the game to the different teams. Each is free to use the mode of communication and following the roads seems it best adapted to the situation... And with the urgency of the game, against the competition, each trying to go to the more quickly... and forget everything else. Except that at the end of each part, without using clear communication techniques, no chance to have found the right solution... repeat the exercise with communication secure leads, each time to find the solution.

In summary, this game is more meaningful than all the usual seminars playful setting, and which led to doubt one's understanding...

User summary:
Game is only played with 4 players, 2 on each time. One of each pair of players is the apprentice attempting to find the treasure with the map by blindly pushing a smaller red player piece. As you get closer and closer to the treasure (likely different colours or borders to indicate different zones), the other player (playing your pirate mentor) has their directions conveyed more and more muffled to simulate their memory or your understanding of their directions becoming less and less certain. Either it's a time trial between the two teams, going one at a time or it's simultaneously play (and the first to reach the treasure wins.

181035.name: LR Kliszow 1702
181035.description: A small simple Hex and Counter Wargame of a battle from the Great Northern war. Rules and Vassal module in files section this page.

181036.name: Cache Cache Party
181036.description:
From the publisher's webpage:

Communication, card, observation, reflex and memory game.

There is a party at the small beasts and They are playing to cache-cache! So where are the small beasts? Who have seen the tomcat? Is it in the cabbages? And the ant, where does it hidden?

We will have to open the eye to find these charming small beasts. Cache Cache Party is a game of observation and speed which proposes to find the small beasts hidden among the fruits and vegetables.

It is necessary to play Cache Cache Party, some memory, a touch of reflex and good look ... But all that is learned, and as a part is you can train faster often. It is a game intended for both small and large through various levels and is beautifully served by Pauline illustratins Stive.

Solid folder box - Card size: 8 x 8 cm - Box size 13 x 9 x 3 cm
Material: 32 square cards with round edges (16 "little creature" card; 16 "fruits and vegetables" cards with 1 (very) large wooden marker.

181038.name: Smartrix
181038.description:
Smartrix is a fun-filled battle of wits for 2-7 players.

Players place their cards so the patterns match, aiming to create point-scoring sets.

Smartrix can be appreciated on several levels; the beginners, it is a smart and fun matching game. As players' skills improve, Smartrix provides deep and captivating strategy, combining memory, risk-taking, tactics and a touch of luck for the sake of suspense.

Have fun the smarter way with Smartix!

181039.name: Honor Among Thieves
181039.description:
You and your gang pulled off the perfect heist. Now all you have to do is sit tight and wait for the right time to escape, grab the stolen goods and meet up with your colleagues. But then again, if they were all caught by the authorities you wouldn't have to split it so many ways...

Mechanics:
You must rid yourself of all incriminating evidence while making sure everyone else has evidence against them. You play cards to get rid of evidence tokens and to force the other players to take evidence tokens, but timing is important. If you pick an action someone else has, you will not get an action that turn, so pick wisely.

Once an action card of yours is played, it stays in your discard until you are "out" (you and one or more other players chose the same action card). When "out" for the round you can pick up all your spent cards.

181040.description:
A silly market day! A great little game of communication for a fun time!

Grandma gave her grandchildren a list of groceries, but there are many market stalls to choose from! The first player to finish their groceries wins.
181040.name: A vos paniers!

181041.name: Skylight
181041.description:
Skylight combines a simple platform jumping mechanic with a changing world and ever-changing audio. You'll need to navigate increasingly sparse platforms and dimming light conditions. Levels are randomly generated, and a procedural soundtrack accompanies you, slowly building up as you travel, and different every time.

Source: The Developer Website.

181042.name: Who's Hue?
181042.description:
Who’s Hue? Is a party game for 3 or more player who guess colorful characters created from colored cards and clever clues. Once all of the players have created a character, the player with the most points wins! It's who you know that matters!

It's a creative party game that doesn’t rely on drawing or sculpting skills.

Each player takes turns as the Creator. The Creator uses three color cards to create the character on the character card. The players take turns guessing the character’s identity. As clues are added, points decrease. The creator and the player who guesses the character correctly earns points. Play continues until all players have been the creator. The player with the most points, wins!

Sequence of Play:

1. The player with the most colorful shirt or dress is the first Character Creator.
2. The Character Creator draws a card from the character card deck and reads the identity of the character to themselves – shown in red at the bottom of the card.
3. Keeping the character card secret from the other players, the Creator uses three color cards to create an image of the character. The cards may be positioned anyway the Creator feels will help the other players guess correctly. For example, the position of the cards might represent "head, body, feet" of the character. Color cards have the names of the colors on one side to help with color-blind players.
4. The Creator gives the players their first clue – the bold subject heading on the character card. Players take turns guessing the characters identity. If a player guesses correctly, the player and the Creator earns four points. If the player doesn’t know the character’s identity, they can pass. The Creator is not allowed to provide a clue further than the one on the card.
5. If the players fail to guess the character’s identity, the Creator reads the next clue on the card. All of the players have a chance to guess again. If the player guesses correctly, the player and the Creator earns three points.
6. Play continues in this fashion with the second to last clue earning two points and the last clue earning one point. If the players all fail to guess, then the Creator earns zero points and the next clockwise player becomes the Creator. (follow rules 1-6 again)
7. Once all players have had a turn as the Creator, the scores are totaled up. The player with the highest score wins. In case of a tie, one more round can be played to determine the winner.

Winning Condition: The player with the most points wins!

181044.name: Scraps
181044.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Scraps is a vehicle combat game where you can build your vehicle from the chassis up from functional parts, with design as your ally and physics as your accomplice. Compete against human or AI opponents in a combat arena, and scavenge from their wreckage to repair and upgrade your own creation.

Scraps lets you create a vehicle that’s great or a vehicle that sucks. Maybe your vehicle falls over when it corners or doesn’t have enough power to fire its weapons – that’s okay. Maybe it doesn’t need an engine because it moves by firing its cannons backwards. You decide what you drive.

Your design choices aren’t just cosmetic – they’re truly functional and at the very least affect the weight and balance of your vehicle. Battle in single-player against the AI, on LAN, or over the Internet. Easily host your own LAN or Internet games. Using the Scraps demo, your friends can join a LAN game even if they don’t own the full game.

Source: The Game Website.

181045.name: Texto!
181045.description:
In each turn of Texto!, the players reveal a card, revealing a category and three letters. Only one of the cards matches the color of the category. You should be the quickest to find a word that starts with that letter and belongs to the category. The first one that succeeds wins the card. Then we start a new round! Whoever accumulates more cards wins.

Texto! is a totally addictive game that will test your wits. It is accessible to all, and everyone plays at the same time.

181046.name: Euangelion
181046.description:
Evangelize the ancient world in this co-op area control game.
A cooperative board game for 1-5 players, you take on the role of one of the disciples of Christ in the 1st century AD. Your goal is to evangelize the world before the world wipes out Christianity.

This game is like Pandemic meets Risk meets Christianity.

Players get to take three actions which including drawing cards, trading cards, moving and making influence checks. Influence checks are the primary mechanic of the game, and involve rolling dice to gain faction points in cities on the map.

The goal of the game is for the players to gain control of a set number of regions before the world faction controls a set number of cities.

181047.name: Arche de la nature
181047.description:
A thrilling adventure in the heart of the Ark of the Nature. Over 600 questions about animals, plants, water and the very nature challenges to complete: who will be able to draw a dandelion? Which animal makes these tracks? Charades, riddles and a beautiful photo gallery: for laughs with family or friends and to discover the secrets of the Ark of Nature almost as if we were there!

A wonderful game for the whole family.

181055.name: Penalties Shootout
181055.description:
The game represents the penalties shootout of a great final of a soccer championship. The goalkeeper tries to guess where the shot goes; the pitcher tries to throw the ball the other side. Simple. It is the same psychological game that the soccer players live before kicking the ball: where should I shoot? Where should I dive to?

It is a card game. Each of the two players has a team composed of 3 Goalkeepers (each one protects a part of the goal: the left side, the right side or the center) and a set of 7 Shooters (each one shoots in one direction: to the left, to the right or to the center Panenka style).

In each throw, the players select one card and show it at the same time. If the Goalkeeper guesses the direction of the ball, he stops the shot. If the Shooter deceives the goalkeeper, he scores a goal. The back side of the Shooter card is used to track the failure or the goal.

There is a version of the game that includes a single team. It represents the previous training of Penalties Shootouts. It could be sold in soccer club shops with cards of all its players of the first team squad.

181056.name: The Perspective (Volume 2, Issue 4 - Jul 2015)
181056.description:
From publisher blurb:

The next issue of the Perspective is here, I have been away...

The beginings of Awerdyn's Tale
Brief Editorial on Games and Social Change
How to Create Creatures and Journey Master Characters for Sojourner's Quest

181057.name: Wardenhale Public Spaces
181057.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Wardenhale, the city with a thousand names. City of Shadows. CIty of Trade, City of Justice. Wardenhale is like every city, and yet like no other"

Wardenhale Public Spaces is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset. As part of the Wardenhale range, it can be combined with other maps in the set to make a huge city area.

Description:
A set of seven public locations, ideal for city adventures. The set includes:

Formal gardens with flowers and a fountain
Small walled garden with a bench and statue
Wide avenue lined with statues
A small public cemetery
An open plaza with benches
An open-air market
A grassy lawn

181059.name: Poseidon's Rapture
181059.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grand Stair stretches behind the scenes of the multiverse,
The Doors upon its unfathomably vast span leading the way to gossamer worlds of limitless variety and infinite possibility. Many worlds have oceans, but in this reality a tide is rising that will soon claim all.

Poseidon's Rapture was once a world where land and sea existed side by side in harmony, but when the great all-father Poseidon vanished, something went wrong. For three hundred years the water has been rising, swallowing cities and continents, forcing mankind onto desperate ships of survival and reducing the tallest mountains to small – and shrinking – islands. In this flooded realm the future belongs to those who have mastered the sea, sailing upon it and diving beneath it. It is a realm of ships and submarines, scavengers and scoundrels, swashbucklers and sea monsters. Open the Door, and get ready to swim.

181060.name: Ancient World Core Setting Guide (Savage Worlds)
181060.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cynric removed his bow and nocked an arrow. Feradul pointed to a tree in the distance, indicating Cynric to shoot near the creatures in the hopes of scaring them away. He let the arrow fly and it thumped into the tree next to them. A loud roar answered the arrow and one of the creatures began bouncing around angrily.
"I think we made it mad!" exclaimed Cynric.
"You think so?!" yelled Roylla. "They’ll be drawn by the glow of the fire! Prepare yourself!"
Feradul stepped back and prepared for the creatures’ arrival. He could see two shadow-like forms moving quickly toward the camp. Off to the side, two more shadows joined in.
The three warriors made a half circle around the fire, waiting for the creatures to come.

Welcome to Dhuran, a world filled with secrets and hope. Ancient World presents a dark fantasy setting where great warriors scour the land to protect the people from the denizens of the deep and the terrifying creatures that call Dhuran home. The people have spent centuries surviving a seemingly never ending blight, but a glimmer of hope shines in the distance. However, as the secrets of Dhuran's ancient past begin to unravel, the veil begins to lift and the true perils of the Known Lands appear. Grab your weapons and armor and lead the fight to reclaim Dhuran!

Ancient World includes:

Five character races - dark elf, dwarf, gray elf, halfling, and human.
Weapons, armor, and relics to equip your warriors.
A selection of dark arts - alchemy, herbalism, runicism, and shamanism.
A gazetteer of the Known Lands.
GM guidance for Ancient World games.
A random adventure builder.
An introductory adventure.
... and more!

181065.name: Ninja Usagimaru - The Gem of Blessings -
181065.description:
The lone wanderer Usagimaru stumbles across a deserted village. It looks ravaged, as if a devastating battle has taken place. He’s not sure what to make of it, until Toyoukebime, the heavenly rabbit, descends from the sky, shrouded in light.

"This village was attacked by monsters known as Mononoke," the rabbit says. “Will you save them?”

"Fate must have brought me here!" cries Usagimaru, "I will gladly help!"

So begins his adventure.

Ninja Usagimaru is a 2D action-puzzle game where Usagimaru saves kidnapped villagers by taking them to the Usagi Statue. Each stage is packed full of obstacles, traps, and monsters—all of which Usagimaru will have to use along with his unique skills to rescue the villagers. Only you can save them!


Exciting puzzle action
Challenging levels
Cute characters and animation
Rabbits
Demo available


Source: The Developer Website.

181067.name: Sur les traces des animaux de la Ferme
181067.description:
Designed for 2 to 6 players, players have to recognize animal prints in this educational game.

There is no need to refer to an instruction manual to determine if a player has guessed correctly: the publisher has developed a system that shows the result immediately. The footprint of each animal is unique and is shown on the backside of the tile with the depiction of the animal. Innovative and very playful, this system brings very great fluidity to the game.

For the youngest, aged 5, a cooperative mode is suggested, which allows to take in hand the prints of each of the 24 animals, allowing for fun and easier gameplay. Then, for older players, the interaction between players is at the heart of the game and greater speed is required.

181068.description:
Designed for 2 to 6 players, players have to recognize animal prints in this educational game.

There is no need to refer to an instruction manual to determine if a player has guessed correctly: the publisher has developed a system that shows the result immediately. The footprint of each animal is unique and is shown on the backside of the tile with the depiction of the animal. Innovative and very playful, this system brings very great fluidity to the game.

For the youngest, aged 5, a cooperative mode is suggested, which allows to take in hand the prints of each of the 24 animals, allowing for fun and easier gameplay. Then, for older players, the interaction between players is at the heart of the game and greater speed is required.
181068.name: Sur les traces des animaux de la Foret

181069.name: Corner Lot
181069.description: A small economic auction game loosely themed around property investing, but focused on set-collecting and reminiscent of the private auction in many 18xx games.

181070.name: The Talent Game
181070.description:
From the directions: "The Talent Game was designed to depict the Christian's journey through life, culminating with entry into the glorious Kingdom of God."

The Talent Game is a family game designed to build Biblical knowledge. Players roll dice to move pawns around a track. As they move, they land on various spaces that require them to answer questions in either various categories or various levels of difficulty. Correct answers earn the players "talents" represented by poker chips as well as moving them forward on the track. In some categories, players will lose talents for incorrect answers or take talents from other players. Players continue until they reach the final space, known as The Kingdom. The player who finishes with the most talents wins.

181071.name: Bots Battleground
181071.description:
A cards war game featuring the innovative Boogie Dice, in which players gang up to attack a single defender.

Each turn, a player claps their hand. The Boogie Dice, which is sound activated, either remains still, or starts bouncing around. If it does - you must defend against the other players.

Each players has a hand of cards, and each card is a bot with different attributes, so you must strategize well in order to be the ultimate winner of the battleground!

181072.name: Bilby Buddies
181072.description:
From the box: "Bilby Buddies is a matching game designed to teach animal recognition to children between the ages of 18 months-6 years."

There are two ways to play Bilby Buddies, both takeoffs on classic games. In "Bingo Style," each player has a board marked with 12 animals. Players in turn choose a tile from a face-down stack and call out the name of the animal. The player who has the animal on his or her card claims the tile. The first player to fill the boar wins.

In "Memory Style," each player gets a game board. The 48 animal tiles are spread out face-down. Each player in turn takes a tile, tries to match it to their card, and if it doesn't match, puts it back face-down. Other players may gain an advantage by remembering which tiles are where. The first player to fill his or her card wins.

181074.name: Woordzoeker Turbo
181074.description:
In this Turbo-version of the original Wordquest, players spin the wheel which decides the word you should search all toghether.

The player who's first able to grab the totem and to show the word gets the token.

Be the first player with three tokens to win the game!

181075.name: Asdivine Hearts
181075.description:
Using the latest in visual expression capabilities for smartphones, the world of Asdivine has been rendered with stunning detail.

From meandering clouds to lapping waves, sparkling magic to slithering creatures, and even dynamic skill effects, Asdivine Hearts breaks new ground in 2D turn-based RPGs!

Along for the ride is Stella, who just cannot seem to tame her emotions; the mysterious yet obsessively-compulsive Uriel; the imposing but shortcoming-laden high priestess, Celine; and Felix the self-proclaimed Light Deity who mistakenly possessed the body of a cat. Though at times their relationship is strained, it is not long before they come together and focus their efforts on the same goal. That is, if their personal feelings for Zack don't get in the way.. Now not only the world hangs in the balance, but who Zack will eventually end up with, too!

Source: The Publisher Website.

181076.name: Hunter Island
181076.description:
User Summary

The game has a vast world to explore and an epic story to uncover. The island is suffering from war, drought, and other unusual disasters, and therefore the people living there need a hero like you. In order to put a stop to these disasters, you need to find out why the ancient civilizations disappeared.

181077.name: Zombie Slayer
181077.description:
Exterior - night.
A lone slayer stands in the market place, gazing.
Suddenly, a flash of light appears in the sky, and a flaming meteor plummets to the Earth.

"All right", he thinks. "Now we're cooking!"

Welcome to Zombie Slayer!
An evil necromancer has overrun a (formerly) peaceful village with his army of zombies.The zombies are roaming the streets in search for human flesh. Though there are some townspeople left, the main attraction is you - the slayer that has been called to take care of the problem.
Can you save the townies and defeat the evil necromancer?

Zombie Slayer is a free print & play solitaire fantasy game, putting you into the role of a Warrior that has been called to rid the evil off the land.
For starters, you might want to play with the pre-generated slayer, but there are rules provided to create your own slayer.

You explore the town by drawing the different parts of the town from a deck. Whenever you move through the town, Zombies will spawn around you, trying to finish you off.
If you're lucky, you may run into villagers as well or maybe in one of the buildings you find your treasure helping you on the way?

Aside from the card drawing exploration mechanic, everything else (combat, searching) is dice driven - and you will roll dice a lot!

181078.name: Rohan: Blood Feud
181078.description:
Rohan: Blood Feud (an English-speaking version of the recently released Rohan Online) is a free-to-play massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG). One week of closed beta testing in America started from March 17, 2008 by publisher YNK Interactive. It ended its one week of closed beta testing.[1][2] Second round of closed beta testing ran from April 3, 2008 to April 9, 2008, the open beta was launched May 28, 2008. There are other versions of Rohan Online in Korea, Taiwan, Japan, Indonesia, and Philippines as well.

Rohan: Blood Feud is a massively multiplayer online role-playing game that allows players to play with another character within the game world, explore lands, kill monsters, engage in quests, perform magic, adopt a pet, buy a mount, and interact with NPCs and other players. The game includes a player-versus-players system, including a "Vengeance" system. Players can also participate in in-game groups called "Guilds", which have the opportunity to control areas within the game, dictating rules such as taxes, or battle other guilds.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rohan: Blood Feud", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

181079.name: Lara Croft: Relic Run
181079.description:
From the publisher website

Lara Croft: Relic Run is a fast-paced free-to-play infinite runner with big adventure moments, over-the-top action and, of course, loads of collectibles. You won't just be running, swinging and sliding through the ever changing maze ahead though - you'll also be jumping onto motor- and quad bikes as well as chasing (or running away from…) boss fights with your trusty pistols and all manner of other weaponry at hand. And before you ask… Yes, the swan dives, the handstands, and even the T. rex are all in there.

181080.description:
Pitch Fleet is an action/dexterity game.

Competing over several stages, players are divided into two teams and compete to arrive at the goal planet first. Players can also gain points by landing on satellites, completing the missions on the cards, or even pushing out the starships of opponents!

Don't worry if you don't have confidence with your motor skills as players change teams during different stages, therefore allowing you to get support from those players who are better than you.

Just enjoy the beautiful trips through the solar system!
181080.name: Pitch Fleet

181081.name: Hipster
181081.description:
Welcome to the pretentious game of Hipsters. A world of social intrigue, popularity and betrayal. In a game of "Hipster", you will fight over the current trendy location and its hipsters. By spending items or purchasing items, you can pretend to be something, that you are not. The hipster who persuade the most followers, win the game.

Are you ready to become a pretentious board gamer?

GAME PLAY:

Setup: Each player draws a random Hipster card from the Hipster cards deck. Add it facedown in front of the player. Add the “In the City" starting location card to the middle of the table. Each player draws 5 single value Item cards from the Item cards deck.

Shuffle the Item cards deck and split them into X piles face up (X is the number of players). Shuffle the Hipster deck and split them into X piles face up.

The player with the lowest Hipster initiative, chooses the starting player. Players take their turn clockwise.

Round: Starting with the first player, the player can play five Item cards from their hand. Each card has a printed status value, which can be used to purchase other Item cards. Item cards also have bonuses, when paired with other items. The more you combine, the bigger the pay off.

The player can also “make a move” on a new hipster, from the Hipster deck, at the current location (not another players hipster). They do this, by spending items equal to or higher then the Hipsters printed status value. They place these item cards facedown at the location, and in that players turn, other players can fight for attention, buy spending items which subtract from the cards added by the initiating Hipster. When another player choose to spend items, the cards are discarded afterward and they will have that amount of card less in their turn, as they have played their card out of turn.

Each Hipster card, has different status values with each an attached event. The player can choose to “buy” one of these statuses and activate the attached event. When buying a hipster, it becomes part of that players following. Each hipster card also has a printed association (i.e. Cafe Hipster). The players gathers hipsters, which match their starting hipster association, as they are the only one giving credit when ending the game.

If a player has spotted, that another player is collecting a specific association/trait, they can challenge that player by naming the trait. If they are correct, the player can once per game, select that players current hand. If they are incorrect, they must give the other player their hand. When a Hipster is bought, the player can choose to change location, as each location has events or abilities that might make things better or worse for the other players as the location will alter items and hipster values, traits and abilities.

Ending the game: The game ends, when there are no more hipsters in the hipster deck.

Winning Condition: The Hipster with the most like-minded hipsters win the game (cards of the same trait).

181082.description:
Blood on the Streets is a 132 page hardback book which supplements the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game.

From the back of the book:

Life has never been easy in Mega-City One but, with BLOOD ON THE STREETS, it's about to get a lot tougher!

With Blood on the Streets, you will now have a new way to fight in Mega-City One, the Cursed Earth and beyond, with a new range of scenarios tailored specifically for each force. These allow you to play games that reflect the comics and the activities your force will be typically getting up to. For example, you can now play:


Judges rushing to extract an informant from a criminal before he is rumbled.
City-Def soldiers conducting a weapons test on a rival block.
Apocalypse War Resistance fighters engaging in a midnight raid on an enemy position using bat gliders.
Sky Surfers practising for the next Supersurf competition.
A mob war between organised crime syndicates.
The Angel Gang rescuing captured family members.
Chief Judge Cal using Klegg mercenaries to hunt down traitors.
Cursed Earth Desperadoes holding a fort against all-comers.


Amongst many, many others.

Blood on the streets also includes rules for all the latest releases in the Judge Dredd miniatures range, including Max Normal, Grampus, Shamed Judges, and the full force lists for the Judda, Klegg Invasion Forces, Mechismo Strike Forces and the ABC Warriors.

If that were not enough, there are new Talents, allowing you to further specialise your Heroes, Judges and psychics with truly awesome feats of skill and ability.

Welcome to Blood on the Streets. Mega-City One has never been deadlier.
181082.name: Judge Dredd Miniatures Game: Blood on the Streets

181083.name: European Union: The Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Big Fun Games
181083.description:
European Union: The Board Game is a game for 3 to 7 players (or 3 to 5 players for the basic version). Each player takes the role of the leader of a European political party; each party has different policy preferences and special abilities. Players have to try to get the proposals that are most advantageous to them approved, whilst securing the maximum number of influence points that they can in each round. The game is played over three rounds, which simulates the increased membership of the European Union over time. The player with the highest number of influence-points at the end of the game wins.

During the game, each player uses their influence points to secure voting powers by bidding for Member States in the Council of the European Union (the Council) and Members of the European Parliament (MEP) (the Parliament), if playing the advanced version. The party with the highest bid also becomes the President of that institution, i.e., when bidding for the Member States in the Council, the highest bidder becomes the President of the Council. The President is a powerful figure with the ability to set the agenda for each round, chair discussions, and call votes.

Players can lobby other parties (players) to lend their support or help block proposals, taking into consideration their preferred policies and special abilities. Alliances can also be formed to further a player's objectives. Players can make deals using influence points or verbal commitments at any time during the game. However, the President Card, Party Cards, Member State Cards, and MEP Cards may not be transferred or traded.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
181084.description:
"Salsa" is the Latin word for "salted", and in the Concordia: Salsa expansion for Concordia, players will discover:


Two new maps: "Byzantium" and "Hispania"
Wooden pieces for a sixth commodity: salt
City tokens for additional salt cities
27 Forum Cards for new strategies to follow


The cards are all different, can be acquired during the game, and salt your game with new strategic challenges! Some cards have permanent effects, others return to stack after using. Both the sixth commodity and the new cards can be played with the base game and the Britannia expansion as well, thus giving even more variety.
181084.name: Concordia: Salsa
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 120: Terraforming Mars, La Granja and The Hype Machine
Episode 39 - Our Most Anticipated Games in 2017
Episode 66 - Raiders of the North Sea

181085.description:
Kickstarter and Giochistarter exclusive development card for the Bomarzo boardgame.

This card represents one of the most iconic structures inside the Sacred Woods of Bomarzo and can be shuffled in the Development deck to be drawn by players during the game.

It provides 1 Architecture point when deployed and 3 architecture points when evolved on its b-side.

Also, the evolved side of the card provides 1 silver resource in every Production phase.
181085.name: Bomarzo: The Crooked House

181086.name: Galactic War One: The First Great War on a New Frontier
181086.description:
Interstellar armies compete for dominance in unclaimed sectors of a galaxy made accessible by the discovery of warp gates.

The rules are Company level rules meant with 15mm in mind. Though they can be used with 28mm with a little adjustment to the ranges and movement distances. Armies consist of several units which are made up of three to six infantry fire teams or vehicles.

The system includes rules for all kinds of cool sci-fi troop types that include walkers, grav vehicles, and giant fliers that can not only transport large quantities of infantry, but also vehicles as well.

The Universe is meant to be a pretty open and accessible space opera.

There are 7 forces to choose from that range from the forces of Terra, to mysterious psychic aliens.

181089.name: Raben schubsen
181089.description:
Every raven has its favorite resting place. But all the good spots are usually taken up fast. So, in order to protect their territory, the ravens are constantly pushing each other off their perch. No sooner has a raven settled down on its perch, does he find himself plummeting downwards. Try to find the best spots on your side of the wall to perch your ravens and at the same time knock your opponent’s birds from their perch on his side of the wall. Who will have the most ravens perched up on his side of the wall at the end of the game?

The youngest player begins. Then take turns. On your turn, roll
the die. Try to roll it so that both of you can see the result.
Depending on what the die shows, here’s what happens:

- White raven
You‘re in luck! White ravens are rare. Take a raven
lying next to the wall and place him on top of your
side of the wall on the merlon. He is safe here and
can no longer be knocked off the wall.

- Black raven
Take a raven lying next to the wall and place it on
any perch that only shows on your side of the wall.

- Knock a raven from the wall
It’s time to knock your opponent’s ravens from the
wall: Think about where your opponent may have
set one of his ravens and slide out the perch from
under his talons. Choose the perch you think an
opponent’s raven is resting on and pull it onto your
side of the wall. If you guessed right and knocked a
raven from his perch, your opponent has to put him
back next to the wall with the other ravens.

- It’s your choice: Black raven or knock a raven from the wall
You can either take a raven from the pile next to the
wall and put it on a perch on the wall, or you can
knock a raven from the wall by pulling a perch from
your opponent’s side onto your side of the wall.

boardgameintegration: Shadows of Brimstone: Caverns of Cynder Expansion
Shadows of Brimstone: Doorways into Darkness
Shadows of Brimstone: Caverns of Cynder Expansion
Shadows of Brimstone: Doorways into Darkness
181090.description:
Shadows of Brimstone: Caverns of Cynder Artifacts #1 Game Supplement is pretty much what it says, a supplement for the Shadows of Brimstone: Caverns of Cynder Expansion.

CONTENTS
15 cards total

Card #53 Cynder Artifact Ash of Shadow x2
Card #54 Cynder Artifact Belian Robes x2
Card #55 Cynder Artifact Amulet of Cynder x2
Card #56 Cynder Artifact Stone Shield
Card #57 Cynder Artifact Stone Polearm
Card #58 Cynder Artifact Fire Axe
Card #59 Cynder Artifact Chronicle of the Fall
Card #60 Cynder Artifact Armor of the Fallen
Card #61 Cynder Artifact Chains of Conquest
Card #62 Cynder Artifact Fire Parasite
Card #63 Cynder Artifact Ring of Oro’sia
Card #64 Cynder Artifact Stone Blade
181090.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Cynder Artifacts Supplement

181091.description:
The little ladybug wants to dress up. She’s bored with her black dots today and wants to try on something new and colorful. Do you think you can help her out? Together, gather colorful dots for her new outfit. And whoever has the ladybug at the end of the game wins and gets to fly around the room.

Getting started:
Put the 12 colored dots on the leaf and place it in the middle of the table well within everybody‘s reach. The youngest player receives the plush ladybug and die. That‘s it! Now you can start the game.

Take turns in a clockwise direction. The youngest player slides on the plush ladybug over his or her right or left wrist. Then roll the die. Depending on what is showing on the die, here‘s what happens next:

- Hurray! A new color!
Pick up a matching colored dot from the leaf and stick it on any free circle on the plush ladybug. It doesn‘t matter who has
the ladybug around his wrist.

- Oh, oh. There are no more dots of this color!
Are there no more dots on the leaf maching the color you just rolled? No problem. The player to your left tries his luck and rolls the die.

- Ladybug, change hands!
You already have the ladybug on your wrist? Great! You can keep it! You don‘t have the plush ladybug? Then the player who has it has to give it to you. Slide the plush ladybug over your wrist.

- End of game:
Have you attached all the colored dots onto the ladybug? Then the game is over. If you have the ladybug around your wrist, you‘ve won the game and get to fly once around the room! Ladybug, ladybug, flyyyyyy!!!
181091.name: Mein kleiner bunter Krabbelkäfer

181092.description:
Shadows of Brimstone: Badlands Expedition Game Supplement This 15 card Game Supplement for Shadows of Brimstone introduces the first Adventure Card to the game – The Badlands, as well as a host of exciting new Gear, Artifacts, and Encounters themed for exploring this dangerous but rewarding region. With the new Badlands Adventure Card, any Mission can be played in the Badlands to add extra Danger as well as extra rewards to your Adventure!.

On the far edges of the Western deserts near Brimstone lies a desolate region known as The Badlands. Few dare to explore out that far as the tales of burning sands, rampaging creatures crazed for Dark Stone, and massive Void Twisters are said to spell certain death to any foolhardy enough to try. But there are also stories of great riches buried in the Earth, otherworldly cities of gold and ancient statues made from pure Dark Stone… a fortune beyond reckoning, just waiting to be discovered! High risk, but potentially higher reward. The Badlands await!
181092.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Badlands Expedition Supplement

181093.name: No Quarter (Issue 61 - Jul 2015)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
181093.description:
Tournament Triple Threat: Circle Orboros
Contact with Khador (Part 3)
Cosplayers of Lock and Load 2015

181094.description:
Set of Scourge Rats Miniatures. To be Released at GenCon 2015. It consists of 12 Scourge Rats and a Rats' Nest:







.
181094.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Scourge Rats / Rats Nest Enemy Set

181095.name: Pyrolysis
181095.description:
A sokoban-based 3D puzzle game.

Source: The Developer Website.

181096.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Scafford Gang is one of the most notorious Mutant Outlaw gangs in the West! They make their hideouts up in the hills and mines around Brimstone and have become hideously mutated by the corrupting effects of the Dark Stone there. The Dark Stone Brutes are members of the Scafford Gang that have become fused with rock and the Dark Stone, itself, growing out of control to become hulking monsters! Towering over other humans, the Dark Stone Brutes have become crazed, responding only to fellow members of their gang, and smashing any others that come too close, with their powerful rocky arms!

The Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add the lumbering mutant Dark Stone Brutes to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! There are three large Dark Stone Brute models included, as well as the large Enemy Record Sheet and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.

CONTENTS
1x rulebook with painting guide
3x dark stone brutes models
1x large enemy record sheet
2x 1 dark stone brute (threat: Low) cards
2x D3 Dark Stone Brutes (threat: Medium) cards
1x 3 Dark Stone Brutes (Threat: High) cards
1x 3 Dark Stone Brutes and 2 Threat Cards (Threat: Epic) cards
181096.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack

181097.name: Bombing Bastards
181097.description:
Have a blast! Bomb oodles of nasty critters in a series of 30 wicked mazes! Defeat hellish bosses in heroic fights! Play solo, or up to 5 players in merciless battles! Embark on a hilarious journey with the witty Dr. Wallow to conquer the galaxy in this explosively fun arcade game!

Key features:

5 picturesque worlds with 30 wicked mazes.
A huge bestiary of critters to blast.
A multitude of items and power ups to collect.
5 hellish boss levels whose punishing difficulty will only be matched by the satisfaction you’ll get once you beat them.
A hilarious single-player adventure where you help the witty Dr. Wallow get rid of all the critters and become the ruler of the galaxy.
A fully customizable battle mode for 2 to 5 players using the Gamepad, Wii Remotes, Pro Controllers and/or Classic Controllers.
Over 10 minutes of caustic comments from Dr. Wallow, voiced by David Goldfarb.
7 famous pieces of classical music electronically butchered by Samuel Safa.

Source: The Publisher Website.

181098.description:
Shadows of Brimstone: Trun Hunters Enemy Set adds additional figures to the Shadows of Brimstone game series. It consists of 3 miniatures. Although not funded according to the Kickstarter totals, it will nevertheless be produced, as evidenced by the shipping manifests received by subscribers.

Includes:
3 Trun Hunters Large Enemy Figures (and 40 mm bases)
1 Double Sided Enemy Reference Card
1 Background Guide
3 Regular Threat Cards (1 low, 1 med, and 1 high)
3 Targa Threat Cards (identical)
1 Assault rule card
181098.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trun Hunters Enemy Pack

181099.description:
Description from the publisher:

Using tears in the fabric of space to pass between worlds, these inter-dimensional travelers cross over in search of raw materials and artifacts to collect. Wearing heavy environment suits to protect them from the hazards of our reality, the Harvesters are nearly indestructible. Often times they are connected to their own world through long hoses that stretch out behind them and extend back through a shimmering gateway, bringing whatever substances they require to sustain them in our world. Lumbering but ruthless, the Harvesters are relentless in their search for anything of interest or value to bring back to their own dimension.

The Shadows of Brimstone: Harvesters From Beyond Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add these terrifying, alien Harvesters to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! There are three large Harvester models included, as well as the large Enemy Record Sheet and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.
181099.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Harvesters From Beyond Enemy Pack

181101.description:
Description from the publisher:

Trederra is a distant, industrial age alien world that is engulfed in massive, never-ending conflict between its varied nations. They fuel their weapons of war with Dark Stone, in an arms race for dominance and destruction! Now, they have begun to run out of resources, especially the Dark Stone needed to build their bombs, tanks, and munitions. Desperate to gain the upper hand, they send out raiding parties through the many Gates that have torn open on their world. These raiders are ruthless in their search for Dark Stone and will stop at nothing.

The Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran Raiders Enemy Pack contains everything you need to add these alien soldier Trederran Raiders to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! There are six Trederran Raider models included, as well as the large Enemy Record Sheet and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.
boardgameversion: English preview edition at Gen Con 2015
181101.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran Raiders Enemy Pack

181102.description: Shadows of Brimstone: Burrower XXL Enemy Miniature - To Be Previewed At GenCon 2015
181102.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Burrower XXL Enemy

181103.description:
Description from the publisher:

Once simple rats, the Hell Vermin have become deformed and twisted by the raw evil of the Darkness. These beasts have grown giant, sprouting multiple heads, a ridge of nasty spikes along their back, and a massive barbed tail to lash at their enemies! Their fangs drip with shadow and hate, corrupting those that are bitten, while their bodies mend even the most grievous of wounds. Only from the pits of Hell could such fiends be spawned!

The Shadows of Brimstone: Hell Vermin Enemy Pack — which debuted at Gen Con 2015 under the name Shadows of Brimstone: SECRET Enemy Set #1 — contains everything you need to add the snarling mutant Hell Vermin to your games of Shadows of Brimstone! There are three large Hell Vermin models included, as well as the large Enemy Record Sheet and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.
181103.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Hell Vermin Enemy Pack

181104.description:
Description from the publisher:

The vicious Swamp Slugs that lurk in Jargono are terrifying to behold! These massive molluscs can grow to enormous size with an underbelly lined with razor-sharp mandibles and a maw filled with tiny grinding teeth to devour their prey! Acidic mucus oozes from their gnarled skin to help ward off enemies and to aid in digestion once they have caught a meal.

The Shadows of Brimstone: Swamp Slugs of Jargono Enemy Pack — which debuted at Gen Con 2015 under the name "Shadows of Brimstone: SECRET Enemy Set #2" — contains everything you need to add the Swamp Slugs to your games of Shadows of Brimstone. There are three large Swamp Slug models included, as well as the large Enemy Record Sheet and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games.
181104.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Swamp Slugs of Jargono Enemy Pack

181105.name: Green Jackets and Voltigeurs
181105.description:
From the website:

This game has been developed as a fast-paced, fun and exciting method of playing Napoleonic Skirmish Games set in the Peninsular War. The rules are easy to play, allowing the War Gamer the creativity in designing or modifying the rules to their own standards utilizing their own scenarios or using the numerous scenarios included based loosely on many historical skirmishes and some fictionalized accounts throughout Portugal and Spain. The game uses a random card generating system, in which each miniature figure is matched to a game card shuffled into the card deck. Figures are assigned a random number of Action Points each turn based on a 1d6 die roll at the start of each round so their action abilities also change each turn.

181106.name: Shadows on the Vatican Act I: Greed
181106.description:
Visiting Rome from Chicago, where he works as a doctor, ex-priest James Murphy answers a mysterious call for help from his friend Cristoforo.
The disappearance of a briefcase containing compromising documents is enough to convince James that his friend is a victim of something shady and sinister. The Vatican’s involvement and some strange parallels with his own traumatic past inspire James to get to the bottom of this mystery.

Along this dangerous and disturbing path, James finds the most unlikely travelling companion who will question his deepest beliefs. And so the two characters begin both a physical journey in search of the truth, and a metaphysical exploration of the inner soul and the darkest secrets that everyone hides, even a “champion of the faith” like James.
Rome is the stage for this adventure – a city bathed in eternal twilight, its skies tinted the color of blood spilled in more than thirty years of intrigue: blood of innocents and guilty, unknown and famous victims alike.

Source: The Publisher Website.

181107.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 4 - Feb 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Increasing the Player Base of Phoenix
Playing Your First Game of Machiavelli
The History of the Lands of Nevron
181107.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 4 - February 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181108.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 5 - Mar 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Do Graphics Have a Place in PBM?
Galactic Encounters of the PBM Kind
Hyborian War & The Road of Kings
Silverdawn, Squad Leader, and the Naked Orc
The PBM Industry Awards for March 2014
Using Play By Mail in a Novel's Plot
181108.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 5 - Mar 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181109.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 6 - Apr 2014)
rpgissuearticle: How to Make Players and Influence Friends
The Top Five Game Designers of Our Generation
To Spur Them Over the Ice
181109.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 6 - April 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181110.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 7 - May 2014)
rpgissuearticle: The Walled City of the State of Trinsic
181110.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 7 - May 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181111.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 8 - Jun 2014)
rpgissuearticle: From the Archives of Charon Empire
An Open Invitation to the Player Base of Turn-based Games
181111.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 8 - June 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181112.name: Das große Reitertreffen
181112.description:
This game includes 6 different game options for horse races and a fox chase. Movement is determined by 1 or 2 dice.

1. Simple horse race for 2 players with 3 horses
2. Simple horse race for 3 players with 2 horses or up to 6 players with one horse
3. "Fox Chase" for 2 players with 3 horses and 1 player with 1 fox)
4. "The Big Horsemen Meeting" for 2 players with 12 horses
5. "Push Through" for 2 players with 6 horses
6. "Stop! Don't Move!" for 2 players with 12 horses

181113.name: Suspense & Decision (Issue 9 - Jul 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Brute Force in Comparing Build Strategies
High-Fi Gaming in a Low-Fi World
Response to Rick: Regarding Issue #7 Article
181113.description:
Suspense & Decision
Issue 9 - Jul 2014
Cover art by A. Kaviraj

181114.description:
Scoville: Labs has few components, but is an expansion that adds significant depth to Scoville.

Every player receives a 3x3 lab on which they can additionally "plant" peppers. You collect cross-bred peppers based on what is next to a new pepper when you place it into your lab. Nobody else can play on your personal lab board, and no one can walk through it to produce peppers either. With more planting to do, each player starts with a second "plant 1 extra pepper" token.

Scoville: Labs also comes with additional wooden peppers, new recipe cards, and pepper multiplier tokens.
181114.name: Scoville: Labs
boardgamepodcastepisode: #20: Ed Marriott interview, Scoville: Labs, and Scoville on tap
Podcast 41: Scoville and Scoville: Labs
Vox Republica 118: A Quarriors Qretrospective
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80

181115.name: Task Force H.A.T.
181115.description:
Task Force H.A.T. (Heroes Against Tyranny) was formed by the United Nations to combat dangers to the global community. Recruits are bonafide action heroes, like we might see in the movies. Task Force H.A.T. agents are deployed against dictators, drug lords, and the like, when diplomacy and attempts to bring suspects in quietly have failed. Agents are authorized to neutralize the threat by any means necessary. If they manage to collar the perpetrator in their operations, so much the better. Task Force H.A.T. is meant to be played as if it were an action movie. The player characters are the stars of this movie, as such they are protected by the power of the plot. The plot has certain demands on its stars though and if they hope to get better and continue upping the ante on the evil forces of the world they will have to strive to earn Action points. Task Force H.A.T. is intended for 2-4 players.

Players earn Action Points by killing bad guys, making cheesy action movie puns and just doing cool stuff in general. Action Points are used to avoid attacks and activate certain special abilities that give players an advantage against their foes.

The heroes must complete a series of missions to level up their characters and equipment. The better they do on each mission, the faster they are able to upgrade their special abilities and equipment!

181116.name: Le Tour du Monde a Bicyclette
181116.description: A roll-and-move game for six players. The first player to reach the last space of the track wins the game.

181117.name: Franc-Rêveur (Issue 0 - Oct 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Les Carnets de Voyage de Peppone le Baroudien
181117.description:
Une aide de jeu Rêve de Dragon
Les humeurs de Frédéric Weil
Scénar Vampire
Plein de News
Et Plus Encore

181118.name: Franc-Rêveur (Issue 1 - Dec 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Les Carnets de Voyage de Peponne le Baroudien pour Rêve de Dragon
On ne Choisit Pas Son Avatar
181118.description:
Scénars: Mage, AD&D, Château Falkenstein
Des News
Attention les éditeurs parlent...
Et plus encore...

181119.name: Franc-Rêveur (Issue 2 - Feb 1996)
rpgissuearticle: La Vente Aux Enchères de la Collection Von Urtaü
181119.description:
Scénars: Château Falkenstein
San Francisco by Night
Des News
Et Plus Encore

181120.description:
Since eons ago, two ancient civilizations are fighting a never-ending battle. Both worlds use all their fleets and intelligence in a dispute that will define the future of their planets.

Pocket Invaders recreates a retro atmosphere in a strategic game, with a universe in which the maneuverability of your ships is as crucial as luck when introducing new units in your fleet.

•••

Desde hace eones, dos antiguas civilizaciones se enfrentan a una eterna batalla. Ambos mundos usarán toda su flota y su inteligencia en una batalla que definirá el futuro de sus planetas.

Pocket Invaders recrea una atmósfera retro dentro de la estrategia. Un universo donde hay que tener en cuenta el movimiento de tus naves y el azar al introducir nuevas invasoras a tu ejército.

•••

Seit Ewigkeiten kämpfen zwei uralte Zivilisationen einen nie enden wollenden Krieg. Beide Welten verwenden sowohl ihre Kriegsflotte als auch ihre Intelligenz in einem Streit, der die Zukunft ihrer Welten bestimmen wird.

Pocket invaders stellt eine retro-Atmosphäre in einem strategischen Spiel dar; ein Universum, in dem die Wendigkeit deiner Schiffe so wichtig ist, wie dein Glück, wenn du neue Einheiten in deiner Flotte einbringst.
181120.name: Pocket Invaders
boardgamepodcastepisode: ChatarraDigital 2x04: Pocket Invaders
HLG-EXTRA 3: Spiel 2016 Deel 1

181121.name: Franc-Rêveur (Issue 3 - Apr 1996)
181121.description:
Scénars et Aides de Jeu: Nephilim, James Bond 007
San Francisco by Night - La Chronique
Interview Jennifer Hartshorn, Ian Lemke
Des New Croustillantes...

181122.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Wrath of Dragons, each player assumes the role of a dragon that, over the course of many centuries, flies into different regions of the Old World to lay waste to settlements, scorch fields, snatch livestock, take gold, and capture nobles.

After six centuries have passed, the devastation, destruction, and fear that the dragons have caused is scored, and the dragon that earns the most victory points wins!
181122.name: Wrath of Dragons
boardgamepodcastepisode: RDTN Episode 83 – Fortress Around Your Heart – Stronghold 2nd Edition Review and a bunch more

181123.description:
from the English Version by Harebrained Schemes

An additional set of the same six double-sided map tiles included with the Golem Arcana Base Game Set. You can use these additional tiles to double the size of the battlefield and play larger games.


from the German Version by Pegasus Spiele
Die Golem Arcana Spielplan Erweiterung 1 enthält noch einmal alle sechs TDI Spielplan-Teile des Grundspiels Golem Arcana. Da diese doppelseitig sind, wird Spielern hiermit ermöglicht, ihre Golems in größeren und abwechslungsreicheren Geländen aufeinander loszulassen.
