181123.name: Golem Arcana Map Tiles 1

181124.description:
Two players are in a haunted house with a roaming monster! Each tries to manipulate the monster's path so that their opponent gets caught, allowing them to escape.

The gameplay takes place in two phases. First the players take turns to place 15 room cards in a 4 x 4 layout, with one space. The player and monster cards are placed in the rooms during this phase.

Next, players take turns to rearrange the rooms by sliding one or more cards to fill the space, and then move the monster according to the instructions on its room card. The first player to be caught loses the game while the other player escapes.
181124.name: It's a M-Monster!
boardgamepodcastepisode: PNPCAST 001: It’s a M-Monster! and Minirail

181125.name: Save Our Souls: The Deck De(con)struction Game
181125.description:
In Save Our Souls 2 to 4 players try to evacuate (reduce to 0 cards) their doomed cruise ships (their deck).

Ever since Dominion and the early adopters of the deckbuilding mechanism had been released, the designer mused about a deck de(con)struction game being released just being a matter of time.
Up to now, nobody has implemented this in a way that uses deckbuilding mechanisms and where the sole goal is to empty the deck (Valley of the Kings being very close though).

Rescue cards from your deck, buy action cards to speed up things, be the first to empty the deck (pun intended).

181126.description:
In In the Loop, you are a product producing company who must meet customer demands. Navigating through resource mines and unpredictable markets will involve making economic, social, political, and environmental trade-offs. You will have to make difficult strategic decisions: should you collaborate with your competitors, invest in mining new materials, or change your business model?

In the Loop gamifies the complex, global supply chain in less than 90 minutes. As the game unravels, players will learn about product lifecycle as well as resource efficient and effective solutions. And they will be ready to come up with their own resourceful strategies.

How it works:
In the Loop is a turn-based game. Players roll dice to move around the board in order to collect material tokens needed to make their products. Event cards occur at intervals throughout the game and hinder or help players' abilities to obtain material tokens. Players can choose to purchase strategy cards to combat these events. The first player to make three products wins!
181126.name: In the Loop
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Boston FIG Tabletop games

181127.name: Twelve Easy Parsecs
181127.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Sci-Fi RPG Mini-Adventure
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 2-4
The Elksrenus Group is looking for a few good beings to test pilot their new hyper-jump drive, a simple trip from point A to point B. Of course things are never quite so easy, are they?

Twelve Easy Parsecs is part of a series of mini-adventures designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side missions or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

This adventure is part of our Astro Adventures series, a new line of products created with ‘old school’ gaming in mind. If you like this adventure watch for other Astro Adventures mini-adventure coming soon.

181128.description:
A network building game for 2 to 4 players. Each card depicts a black and/or a white railway line and possibly a station. Players try to build the highest scoring pair of railway lines, gaining points for longer lines, more stations and closed loops.

Each player is dealt 12 cards and divides them into groups of 3 or 4, depending on the number of players. Everyone then selects groups of cards from each other player, until all players have a new set of 12 cards. Finally, each player tries to lay out their cards to form a black railway line and a white railway line. The player with the highest total score from their pair of lines wins.
181128.name: Minirail
boardgamepodcastepisode: PNPCAST 001: It’s a M-Monster! and Minirail

181129.name: Pets & Predators
181129.description:
From publisher blurb:

We know what you’re thinking. Ever since you picked up Tephra: the Steampunk RPG, you’ve had one aching thought: “How can I bio-engineer a flesh-tearing chimpanzee with venomous fangs and ride it into battle?”

We are proud to announce that your wait is over. This book will provide you the answer to that pressing question and many like it. You will have everything you need to tame the wild lands of Tephra, use science to develop your own animal abomination, or fight off stampedes of raging beasties.

This book includes rules for both players and narrators to create animals and use them in their sagas. With dozens of new specialties, new augments, and a huge selection of animal traits, this book is packed to the gills. Narrator’s will enjoy the selection of pre-built animals and savage creatures ready to insert right into their epic stories.

And the best part: you can now rely on a pet (and not those pesky fellow adventurers) to help you out when you most need it!

181130.name: Sun Seeker
181130.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dwarf heroes of old were called sun seekers after the greatest epic quest they every undertook. Today, a hero taking up the title of sun seeker is calling out his intent to restore the lost glories of the dwarves.

Prestige Class: Skyseeker.
Build Classes: Ranger.

Role: Sun seekers are tunnel warriors and questers, leading parties of explorers to find and liberate the dwarf citadels of old.

181131.name: Sword Lord
181131.description:
From publisher blurb:

The swordlords are among the deadliest and most feared fighters of the world. They have spent long years mastering the dueling sword, against both other dueling swords and all manner of other weaponry. Their speed and reflexes weave a net of impenetrable steel around them, from which they strike and harry their unfortunate opponents. They focus on avoiding damage and disarming foes; swordlords prefer wearing light or no armor, trusting their skill with their blades for protection.

Role: Swordlords are highly talented melee combatants, and while their true mastery shows itself in dueling situations or whenever flashy combat is called for, they can still carry their weight in more conventional battles.

181132.name: White Box Options: Psychic Talents
181132.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Mind is a Terrible Thing to Waste

With White Box Options: Psychic Talents you'll bring the power of the mind to your Swords & Wizardry White Box campaign. This supplement offers full rules for determining whether or not player characters and NPCs possess unique psychic talents. Whether they're able to radiate an aura of dread to unnerve their opponent, sense the presence of beings from beyond the planes or steel their psychic against mental intrusion, your character will have new options in their arsenal. This supplement includes 19 psychic talents and three psychically attuned items ready for your campaign.

181133.name: WarGods: The Wendigo Warband Guide
181133.description:
From the publisher's website:

Fully compatible and playable with WarGods of Ægyptus, this full color guidebook contains the complete rules and background for playing the Wendigo warband in the WarGods of Hyperborea game.

Also included is a full color Wendigo painting guide, a miniature and scenery gallery, two sheets of Wendigo Command Counters and an all new campaign.

181134.name: Baron K'oz
181134.description:
From publisher blurb:

I am immortal

"I have all the time I need to rule everything. The Kiton Empire is already mine. The rest of the Nanoverse will follow. And then, I shall move on to conquer all other realities. It is as inevitable as your own eventual death."

Within the Nanoverse, the subatomic quantum reality found within the smallest scale of our own world, the ultimate threat is the PL 10 Baron K'oz. Once a revered and brilliant scientist, Baron K'oz learned the secret of existing as pure mental energy, and used that secret to conquer his native Kiton Empire. He nearly conquered all of the Nanoverse, but was stopped by the shrinking heroes Myrmidon and Vespa, who then returned to the normal world. But Baron K'oz was stalled, not defeated, and now knows there are other worlds waiting for his iron grip.

181135.name: Terran Marines
181135.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the furthest reaches of unexplored space there are dangers that few have the courage to face. Not everyone has the resolve, adaptability, and intelligence to face the unknown and persevere against overwhelming odds. The people of the core worlds stare nervously at the skies, wondering what hidden menace might be lurking in the realms that lie past their own tiny corner of space. Protecting the citizens of known space from the terrors of the night is the duty of a select group of men and women known as the Terran Marine Corps.

Perhaps the most highly regarded military force in core space, the Terran Marines are an elite service branch under the command of Earth's central government. Recruited from the best and brightest that the human home world has to offer, these ferocious combatants are arguably the best trained and best equipped fighters found among the four core world species.

A fully detailed guide to playing a terran marine in the Fringe setting, inside you will find several new advanced classes geared towards playing a marine, new information on the corps, their goals and training, and a wealth of great gaming goodess.

181136.name: Crew
181136.description:
From publisher blurb:

Very few starships are autonomous. They require a captain and crew to keep her flying. They man the weapons, deal with medical emergencies or even provide security, both within the ship or on missions. Whoever they are, they are the life blood of the ship.

Note : This part of the Starship Kit is not for deciding on the details of the crew, such as race, age, background etc. It assumes you have some character or NPCs ready for use in some way. If you need details for this aspect of the crew, the "Backgrounds & Detials Kit - SciFi Edition" or "Multiverse Kit - Lifeforms"is for you.

181137.name: "O" is for "Organizations"
181137.description:
From publisher blurb:

They Are Legion

This entry in the Icons A to Z series offers additional guidelines and traits for handling organizations in Icons, including:

Agents, a basic agent stock character, and variants
Using Combined Effort in conjunction with agents
Organizations as Qualities, activated for advantage and troubel
Organization abilities, including attributes, specialties, and qualities of their own




Get your Icons game "organized"!

181138.name: Nikki Tesla
181138.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mad science meets punk revolutionary... Nikki Tesla!

A Power Level 10 Renegade, Nikki Tesla is a fun addition to any Mutants and Masterminds campaign. A child prodigy turned self-styled anarchist revolutionary, Nikki Tesla can be a perfect foil for a more 'traditional' super-genius hero. Alternately, she could be just the ally your players need to help them out-invent a more dastardly foe... at least, this week? Easily played as Rogue, Rival, or even romantic interest, Nikki Tesla is certainly primed to make your PCs's lives more interesting!

181139.name: Small Pirate Base
181139.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a moderately sized pirate base, home to up to three pirate craft.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

181140.description: Soyuz ’81: What If The Soviets Had Invaded Solidarity Poland (S81 for short) is a low-intermediate complexity two-player wargame covering the possibilities inherent within the first month of that never-run operation. The Soviet player is cast in the role of aggressor, attempting to make work a classic strategy of “converging columns” advancing from around the periphery of Poland. His success or failure will be reckoned on his ability to bring that country to heel without having to expend an inordinate amount of military and political power to do it.
181140.name: Soyuz '81

181141.name: MSG™: A Game for Professionals
181141.description:
From publisher blurb:

The classic game of corporate irresponsibility, back and better than ever!

It’s five minutes from now. You live in a perfect world.

You live in the free world.

Every new day brings you new challenges. Every new job brings new ­opportunities. You’re the master of your destiny, your own boss.

The future is bright. The future is yours.

You just have to keep your soul.

And your salary options.

A one-evening GM-free game of negotiation and conscience, for three or more players.

181142.name: War on the High Seas
181142.description:
War on the High Seas is set in the year of 1750 around the time that world trade was plagued by piracy, dangerous ocean voyages and fierce wars. Can you a small time merchant battle the stormy oceans and avoid the scourge of piracy to rise up with a fleet of merchant ships and enough wealth to become the leading merchant the world has ever known. Or will you get drawn in to a life of piracy, fighting and stealing your fortune. Or perhaps you will find wealth in war and help your nation conquer the world.

Players begin the game representing one of the major nations of 1750 as a small time merchant with limited ships and wealth, they have to trade goods across the world visiting ports until they can expand. With each new ship they add to their convoy their power across the oceans grows and they must decide when the time is right how they will gain a victory and win the game.

There are four ways to win the game, by trade, piracy, war or a mixture of all three. Each turn players roll a dice and move across the seas from port to port, where they can either trade, attack, offer passage, repair or buy another ship. Attacking ports and other convoys will lead to piracy unless first a letter of marquee is obtained from the players government. Becoming a Pirate has few rewards and will immediately alienate you from ports unless it too flies the Jolly Rodger.

The game evolves quickly and as the players get closer to their winning objectives, a race emerges to either beat them to the pip or to sabotage their efforts and gain some more time to build on their own convoy. Only the brave and unscrupulous can hope to gain a foot hold in the war on the high seas.

181143.name: Deadlock City Bounty Hunters
181143.description:
There is a place in a godforsaken corner in the wild west called Deadlock City. From time to time 2-5 players gather in this city to decide who the most capable bounty hunter is. Who will find out first who is who? Or will the stronger win in the end? This is a game of observation, deduction, deception and luck, for which only 20 cards are needed, so it has no box either.

Setup:
Deal 1 card to each player. Deal a card also to the table face down and put the rest of the deck on top of it perpendicularly.
This card will not be drawn except if the last action is a mandatory draw (with card #2).

Gameplay:
1. Draw a card from the deck next to your own card
2. Put one of these card down in front of you and execute the action on it (active cards #1-#6 and #9, passive cards #0, #7, #8)
The cards are collected face up on top of each other so that the numbers on the cards are visible. The players play in clockwise order.

The game ends when only one player is left in the game or all cards are removed from the deck. In the former case, the last remaining player is the winner. In the latter case the winner is who has the highest card in their hand.

Cards (pieces in the deck):
0 (2) If another player looks at this card, that player is out.
1 (5) Guess a player and a number (except #1). If that player has the card you named, that player is out.
2 (2) You or a player of your choice must put their card down and have to draw a new one. The active card’s (#1-#6, #9) effect does not apply.
3 (2) Secretly look at another player's card in hand.
4 (2) Swap cards with another player.
5 (2) Secretly look at another player's card and compare it with yours. Whoever has the smaller value is out.
6 (2) You are safe from another players' actions for one round.
7 (1) If this card and #5 or #6 are in your hand, you must put this card down.
8 (1) If you put this card down, you are out.
9 (1) You can play this card as any card from #1 to #6. If they guess this card you’re not out but you have to draw another card.

181144.name: Terrorhedron
181144.description:
Terrorhedron is a unique tower defense game for the PC. Unmatched challenge and complexity is introduced to the genre through fully 3D tracks, micro strategy through programmable turrets and 'edge of seat' gameplay is extended to multiplayer with up to 8 players online co-op.

Defend wave after wave of colorful Terrorhedron spheres within attractive abstract grid landscapes. Unlock new infrastructure, turrets, upgrades and tracks in your quest to achieve all the stars. Terrorhedron offers a fresh look, feel and an entirely new depth of experience to a popular genre.

Source: The Developer Website.

181145.name: Shin Samurai Jazz
181145.description:
Shin Samurai Jazz is a platform-adventure game. It combines the likes of film noir and samurai cinema, presenting them with 8-bit graphics, an electro-jazz soundtrack, and a comic/manga-like style creating a unique atmosphere.

Unlike it's predecessor, samurai_jazz, Shin Samurai Jazz features jumping mechanics inspired by chuunori, an old technique used in kabuki theatre to give the illusion of flying. It's combat mechanics consist of hacking and slashing with the ability to juggle enemies and perform mid-air combinations, also inspired by chuunori. While the adventure elements remain intact, the puzzles are more complex with varied level designs and enemy placements/attack patterns that make use of the game's mechanics.

Source: The Developer Website.

181146.name: Ninjahtic
181146.description:
Ninjahtic is an action/adventure platformer with elements of puzzle-solving and stealth. While it's progression is linear, the open-ended nature of every level requires exploration of an abandoned civilization located atop floating islands. Usage of the environment also plays a key role when solving puzzles and dispatching enemy robots throughout.

Source: The Developer Website.

181147.name: Ninjahtic Mind Tricks
181147.description:
Ninjahtic Mind Tricks is an 8-bit hack-and-slash platformer with stealth, adventure, and puzzle elements. Like it's predecessor, Ninjahtic, levels have an open-ended nature and are presented in a linear fashion. Though, several features have been added to the predecessor's formula to create a more varied experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

181148.name: For a Change
181148.description:
User Summary

For a Change is an interactive fiction set in a surreal world where everything is shaded by an incredibly huge wall. Armed with only a small stone, it is your mission to restore the sun to this weird world.

181149.name: The Way of the Pixelated Fist
181149.description:
The Way of the Pixelated Fist is a parkour and martial arts inspired free-roaming cinematic platformer. While it blends together the gameplay concepts of The Prince of Persia and Karateka, they are presented with refined controls and other modern innovations to give the game an intuitive and fluid feel.

Players play as Dag in this successor to Jump/Boxer as he looks to complete the trials within the 36 Chambers scattered throughout a village hidden within a city's rooftops. The trials within the Chambers vary from each set, ranging from puzzle-solving to beat-em-up and stealth mechanics. Along the way, there will be many rival martial artists to beat in friendly sparring matches, martial arts masters to challenge, and a variety of platforming challenges throughout the hidden village.

Source: The Developer Website.

181150.name: Goblinade
181150.description:
You are a goblin entrepreneur who has just opened your very own drink stand - but you are not the only game in town! Fill your stockroom with ingredients to make the drinks customers crave, all the while scheming to destroy the competition. Do you have what it takes to thrive, or will you fall to your rivals' cunning? Find out in Goblinade!

Goblinade is a 2-4 player card game in which players collect ingredient cards in order to stock their "pantry". Customer cards lie face up in the center of the table, each with a list of ingredients. When a player has the ingredients listed on the customer card they may collect that customer. Each customer has a point value ranging from 1 to 3.

During the game players may steal use action and reaction cards to steal ingredients or customers and sabotage other players.
Players may choose to play to a set point value (suggested 7 points) or play until all customer cards have been collected, at which time players get one more turn. Whomever has the most points wins the game.

181151.name: Karma Crystals: Block Master
181151.description:
Karma Crystals - Block Master - (KC01)
Dice-To-Card Matches Get You Through Your Karma Travels!

You can travel through life with good deeds or bad deeds, but karma will follow you either way. In Block Master, your best tactic is to collect that bad karma now and give it to your opponents to get the win. Use your Karma Crystal to block other players from moving through the positive karma path and win!

This 1st entry into the Karma Crystals game collection introduces many of the mechanics we use in all our games, including the Roll Off, Karma Crystals to share bad karma, monster elemental cards and dice matching, game end triggers and completion of the round prior to determining a win, playoffs using game win shards, and auto players. This game features the use of karma move and Block Trophy shards and FOUR monster elemental cards to start your collector’s deck!

Roll dice to work with the various monster elemental cards - monsters are the good guys and help you win! Determine how many karma moves you score per roll and collect your karma move shards, or pass on your no-match karma to another player by attempting to block one of three possible move scores to get a blocking trophy! If you get 11 or more karma moves, that triggers the end the game and a winner is determined at the end of that round!

In addition to the unique dice matching game mechanic, a unique auto player system is also used to facilitate up to EIGHT total players per game. The game also provides an easy way to track multiple game wins for playoffs in case you have more than 15 to 20 minutes to play. No paper score cards and pencil needed - just move and block trophy shards to track and build your scores, and of course, Karma Crystal to track your block attempts!

181153.name: Butts away! Heroes
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Big Fun Games
181153.description:
The forces of darkness are on the rise. In the CAVE, the servants of darkness are gathering power against the world. For the darkness, evil spirits are challenging peace. For the darkness, humans have to remember that evil power is everywhere.

They decide, with a DARK GAME, to punish every human to prove evil is that suffering.

However, doing bad isn't always easy! Heroes are always annoying! During the course of the GAME, BUTTS AWAY! HEROES!, you cannot help yourselves to shout at heroes to butt them away!

181154.name: Swords & Darkness
181154.description:
Upon returning from an important mission, a knight of Athelstern discovers that his king has called upon forbidden magics to stave off defeat in war. It is an act of desperation, and although Athelstern turned that defeat into a victory, it came at a great cost. The magic ate away at the king’s mind, infected his advisors and the army, and turned them against the very country they had sacrificed so much to protect.
The queen, rumored to have survived the chaos and slaughter, hides in the castle somewhere. She is the last, desperate hope for the ravaged Kingdom of Athelstern. This nameless heroic knight, only just returned from his mission, must undertake another, one of the most dire import: Rescue the queen, and save his country.
Swords and Darkness is a side-scrolling action RPG with leveling, stat growth, and a skill system. As you fight you level up, and as you level up you are awarded skill points that can be distributed to your attributes: strength, dexterity, agility, stamina, mentality, vitality, and luck. Finding and reading scrolls will teach you powerful new skills that you can use in battle to destroy your enemies.

FEATURES


Skills like "Shield Bash," "Blade Storm," "Arrows of Light," and many others
A map that shows where you can go, and what enemies are waiting for you there
Dark storytelling that examines the intersection of power and responsibility
Exciting, fast-paced hack-and-slash gameplay


Source: The Publisher Website.

181155.name: Gnome and Halfling Feats
181155.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Gnome and Halfling Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to the easily overlooked races that always find themselves underfoot around the big folks but nonetheless can find a legendary stature that stands tall with any of them. This product contains 18 mythic feats for your half-pint heroes that may be short on stature but long on courage, from Casual Illusionist and Cautious Fighter to Blundering Defense, Lucky Strike, and Desperate Swing!

Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

181156.name: Hunters: The Adventure Card Game
181156.description:
Hunters is a fantasy adventure card game for 1-4 players, where you and your friends take on the role of battle-hardened monster hunters, out to fulfill contracts delivered to the Hunter’s Guild to slay all manner of foul beasts.

Choose your class and build your unique character by selecting from hundreds of abilities, random personalities and backgrounds. Then, work alone or as a team with your friends as you journey out into the wilderness on a hunting contract to track down and defeat a vicious beast in an exciting card-based
adventure.

You will face the dangers of the environment itself on your trek, battling against the elements, treacherous obstacles, native creatures and the unforgiving weather as you hunt your prey through a variety of regions, before finally engaging in mortal combat with your vicious quarry in an epic confrontation to complete your task. At least, until you head back to town to take up another contract.

During the course of your journeys, you will gain experience with each kill. This can be used to purchase new abilities, recover a number of useful items such as weapons, armour, crafting materials, trinkets and hunting trophies, pick up valuable companions to fight by your side, or sustain ongoing injuries that will stick with them for the rest of their hunting days.

Do you dare to venture into the wild?

Gameplay
A game of Hunters involves choosing from a selection of hunting contracts, kitting out your character with abilities and equipment, before working your way through a Region, represented by a deck of cards, on the hunt for your chosen monster. During your hunt, you'll face native enemies that can be combated, challenges to face and obstacles to overcome, all of which are completed using a simple dice-based system.

Combat in Hunters uses a mix of card-based Abilities, dice and a simple resource management mechanic. A Hunter can only take a limited number of abilities with them on a contract, so choosing the right combination for the job is key. These abilities are then used in conjunction with dice to determine the results of attacks. Once a contract is completed, the players can earn experience and rewards, before heading back to town to take on a new contract and a new adventure.

181157.name: Kinnikuman: Title Match of the Hell
181157.description:
Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#20)
"Kinnikuman" is one of famous japanese TV-charactor.
The player turns roulette and goes ahead through the route on the game board. I collect advantageous cards on a route and prepare for the fight with the enemy.

Already out of print.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
2016 UK Games Expo Best Expansion Winner
181158.description:
Colt Express: Horses & Stagecoach, the first expansion for the 2015 Spiel des Jahres winner Colt Express, introduces a 3D stagecoach that rides alongside the train from the base game. The bandits now have horses that they can ride to move faster between the cars, and these horses allow them to jump into the stagecoach as well. The stagecoach is protected by a guard with a shotgun, but a punch in his face would be enough to eject him toward the roof of the train. From there, though, he will annoy the bandits on the roof.

Once the stagecoach is free of the guard, the bandits can collect a new strongbox. Inside the stagecoach, they will also find some hostages who will be worth a ransom at game's end. Careful though, as each hostage has a negative effect that will annoy the bandit for the rest of the game.

Horses & Stagecoach also features new round cards and a new event to add more fun to the game. Whiskey flasks spread inside the train also enhance the faculties of the bandits.
181158.name: Colt Express: Horses & Stagecoach
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 9 - Craig Cillessen & Clockwork Wars Review
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

181159.description:
A simple race game in the tradition of Snakes and Ladders in combination with Game of Goose. Move by die roll. If you land on a grashopper (step forward), sparrow (fall backwards - if indicated) or draw a card and follow instructions. The first to reach space 120 exactly is the winner.
note:
likely published during early 1900s
181159.name: Der gerupfte Spatz

181160.name: The Cypher System Rulebook
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
181160.description:
From the Monte Cook Games website:

"The Cypher System Rulebook will be a hefty hardcover rulebook with all the rules you need to run Cypher System games in a wide range of genres, along with advice on using the system to build and run those campaigns. It will draw in part from content already published in Numenera and The Strange, but tailor that content for play in different genres, and add hundreds of new genre-specific and genre-spanning types, descriptors, foci, creatures, cyphers, and rules elements. It will feature the incredible artwork and production values for which Monte Cook Games is becoming legendary."

181161.description:
Are you better at building with plastic bricks...or explaining how to do it? What if you have to build with your eyes closed or using only one hand? Or if you must explain it without speaking? Can you still be faster than your opponents?

Brick Party is a funny and frenzied game of crazy building! Reveal the special rule for the round, choose your teammate, and get ready. Then grab the blocks and build the shape you choose faster than the others! And in the next round? A new special rule, new partners, and new shapes...for a game that's never boring!

Brick Party contains 36 plastic construction bricks and 165 cards with shapes that must be built by the players.
181161.name: Brick Party
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
#26: Gen Con 2016 wrap-up and Interviews with Jamey Stegmaier & Sun King Brewing
#36: 2016, A Year in Review
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 022 – Origins 2016
Episode 89- Great Western Trail and 2017 Predictions/Resolutions
Essen 2015 - Post Scriptum
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

181162.name: Unlikely Heroes
181162.description:
From publisher blurb:

The life of humanoids is never easy, especially if you have been exiled from your own people. Unlikely Heroes for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game features five such heroes ranging from level 5-7. Including a crippled kobold, an orphaned goblin, and a scholarly hobgoblin, the members of the Redeemed adventuring party are ready to add to your campaign.

181163.name: Hole In The Sky
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
181163.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 0 Adventure

The Lady in Blue, a mysterious figure of cosmic power, enlists a band of simple peasants for a strange task. They are to follow an invisible bridge until they arrive at a hole in the sky – and then jump through. Death awaits all but the bravest, strongest, and luckiest, but the Lady offers a reward beyond all the riches of the world: the chance to change the very stars these peasants were born under, and thus change their destiny.

181164.name: White Box Classics: Reluctant Heroes
181164.description:
From publisher blurb:

You Are Great!

White Box Classics: Reluctant Heroes brings a touch of 1980s fantasy cinema to your Swords & Wizardry WhiteBox campaign. You'll find three new classes - the magical halflings called Feyweave Apprentices, roguish Swordsmen, and the tiny mischievous Pucks. Referees will find two new monsters, the tireless Devil Dogs and the explosive Two-Headed Dragon, to challenge their players. But heroism is not without its rewards, and two new magic items specifically designed for the classes in this book are also available!

181165.name: Pit Fighter
181165.description:
From publisher blurb:

This prestige archetype is all about performance combat from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Combat and needs these rules to function properly.

Any good pit fighter will tell you, it doesn’t matter how well you fight—all the crowd cares about is blood, and they don’t care if it’s yours or the other guy’s. So if you want to survive your time in the pit, make sure the people get their blood, and lots of it. If you’re lucky enough, the audience will be on your side, you’ll feel the roar of the crowd pounding in your chest, and nothing can stop you.

While pit fighters’ lives might seem defined by their profession, some do manage to escape the pits, either by winning their freedom in battle or by breaking their chains in the night. Though they may no longer be pit fighters by profession, they will always be pit fighters at heart, and often long for the excitement of battle and the roar of the crowd years after they’ve officially retired.

Prestige Class: Pit fighter

Core Class: Barbarian

Role: The pit fighter is a stylish and brutal combatant who fights for style even when there is no crowd around. On a team, he keeps the strongest

181166.name: Southlands: Adventures in the Pitiless Sun
rpgseries: Southlands: Adventures Beneath the Pitiless Sun
181166.description:
From publisher blurb:


The Southlands - Realm of Mystery and Adventure

Southlands Campaign Setting offers everything you need to have legendary adventures in a sprawling continent of wealthy desert empires, demon-haunted jungles, and vast savannahs where gnolls and werelions hunt.

Featuring the talents of Wolfgang Baur (Midgard Campaign Setting, Al-Qadim), Ben McFarland (Streets of Zobeck) and Brian Suskind, this 300-page setting book includes:

New character options for Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, with five new PC races—Gnolls, Kijani, Nkosi, Tosculi and Trollkin—plus seven minor races
New magic items and spells, from flying carpets to lotus magic and hieroglyph magic
New foes, perilous locations and deadly hazards, including the Orcs of the Green Abyss, the Corrupted Pyramid of Khensu, the Sorcerers of Nangui, and mummified monkey swarms
The many gods and demons of the Southlands: Anu-Akma , Ogun, Thoth-Hermes, Eshu, Set and more




Here are enough kingdoms, treasures, monsters and adventure hooks to provide years of gaming in the deserts, jungles and tropical mountains. Use Southlands with the Midgard Campaign Setting, or bring its cities, lore, creatures, and characters to any campaign.

181167.name: Dark Gates
181167.description:
Some time ago, the Count of Umber Veil lived on these lands. He was a good and just leader, but one day, tragedy struck. The count became a monster in the shell of a man. Darkness swiftly befell Umber Veil.

The monster enslaved his countrymen and forced them to build a labyrinth in the heart of the mountain that was now his lair, and built the first of the Dark Gates. Once these gates were completed, hell itself broke loose on Umber Veil. The Count was no more - he had become an Unnamed.

In the end, the First Gates were destroyed, but the Unnamed survived. Years went by in peace, until the inevitable return of the darkness. New Gates had been opened. A few heroes banded together to destroyed the Dark Gates and rid the world of the Unnamed once and for all...

Source: The Game Website.

181168.name: Dark Matter
181168.description:
Dark Matter recreates the excitement and frantic gameplay of the title that made history. In 1980, Asteroids was one of the most commercially successful games that helped to establish video games as a lasting entertainment medium. Now, embark on 30 various intergalactic missions in Campaign mode or opt to survive an endless attack in Challenge mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

181169.name: You Must Build A Boat
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
181169.description:
The sequel to 10000000. Travel around a procedurally generated world fighting monsters, gathering treasure and recruiting new members to your crew.

Source: The Developer Website.

181170.name: Journeyman
181170.description:
Cover introduction:

You have worked for five long years -- or more, and longer -- as an apprentice to a master chef of the Kitchen Kingdom, sleeping beneath the stove, bearing up the tears of your master’s onions and scorn, waiting, always waiting for the day.
For today.
Because today, you are no longer an apprentice. Your master, grudgingly or proudly, has told you that you are ready, and that is all the word you need, because with that word, you are a... Journeyman.

181173.description:
Tragedy Looper: Midnight Circle is an expansion for the international version of Tragedy Looper and includes some of the material previously released in the Japanese booklet expansions Midnight Zone and Mystery Circle. It also includes four all-new characters: Forensic, Illusion, A.I. and Scientist.

In more detail, Tragedy Looper: Midnight Circle includes three Basic Tragedy scripts akin to those in the base game and nine scripts located in the Tragedy Sets of Midnight Zone and Mystery Circle. In Midnight Zone, you must be wary of believing everything that you hear for lies abound; in Mystery Circle, all supernatural elements have been banished, leaving players to rely only on logic and deduction.
181173.name: Tragedy Looper: Midnight Circle

181174.name: Creepiest Pet Shop
181174.description:
Help famous horror movie monsters adopt equally monstrous pets into their forever homes in this fast paced, family friendly card game!

Creepiest Pet Shop includes speed, matching, take that, and unique fun artwork and theme to make a game that is easy to learn, fast paced fun that is great for families and is a fun micro game for gamers!

181175.name: 1, 2, 3, Papagei!
181175.description: The animals are Standing in a circle. Suddenly one disappears or one new appears. The Players have to remember the animals to name the right one. The first player who calls the right one gains one point. The first Player who gains five Points wins the game.

181176.description:
Story

The King of Blackthorn rose to power on the strength of his sword, gaining the devotion of the people as he forged a nation and purged the ravages of war. Once a much needed beacon of strength for a foundling kingdom, he has now grown old and is no longer a vital part of a now robust and powerful country. Others have risen to prominence and power within his council. Adept in their machinations and plots, the councilors have their own self serving ambitions. In a shadowy battle of subterfuge they ruthlessly vie against one another for true control of Blackthorn. In this dance of treachery, each must seize as much power as able without drawing suspicion for whispers of treason echo through the halls of the King of Blackthorn. Whispers from fellow councilors designed to implicate and see the competition shortened by a head. The King will call for the axe for any he deems a traitor and there is always the risk that he is not as ignorant of the schemes as he seems.

As a member of the Council of Blackthorn, you must build influence with the kingdom’s factions to expand your political influence. Rumors, bribes, spies and poison are the tools of your trade. Council of Blackthorn is about secretly gaining power while convincing your rival council members that you are not a threat. Deflect all eyes onto your most powerful enemy and take the keys to the kingdom as well as a great seat at his or her execution. Attract too much attention to yourself and the King’s axe will find you!

Gain influence, accuse your rivals, keep your head!

Game Overview and Objective

Council of Blackthorn is a board game for 2 to 6 players. Each player assumes the role of a member of the Council of Blackthorn. There are several different council member characters to play. Each player must build influence with the kingdom’s political factions by playing ally and building cards. Custom dice change the game conditions for each round. As players gain influence and power, they also gain hidden treason points. The players that appear to have the most power will typically gain more treason points. The player with the most treason points at the end of the game is beheaded for treason and is removed from the game. The remaining player with the most total influence points, wins the game.
181176.name: Council of Blackthorn

181177.name: The Locust (ICONS)
181177.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Locust and his gang of high-jumping jackanapes have been picking clean the private collections and fine art galleries in The City. The rumor on the street is that they will soon start looting the collections in the celebrated municipal museums.

The Police Commissioner and Mayor are outraged at this possibility. They have put out the call to the vigilantes of The City to provide security for the prized collections in The City's museums and to also apprehend The Locust as soon as possible...

181178.name: Fire Ants!
181178.description:
Game Overview: A small box, a small price ($10), and big fun! Fire Ants! is a card game where you play as an ant and fires are breaking out throughout the ant colony. As a fire ant, you must extinguish those fires by collecting resources from the card deck. The fires can only be extinguished by collecting a certain number of metal cards, a certain number of plastic cards, and a certain number of water cards. You will also find ant magic cards which can be used in place of any resource card that you need. Each fire card that you extinguish is worth a certain value. The higher the point value on the fire cards, the more resources that are needed to extinguish that fire. At the end of the game, if all fires were extinguished then whoever scored the most points from their fire cards win. However, the game can beat you when seven fire cards are played at the same time and no one can put out the fires. When this happens, your entire colony has burnt to the ground.

Box Contents: The game comes in a small box that easily holds the 90 playing cards within it.

Game Play: At the start of the game, each player is dealt three cards and a five point double sided fire card is placed in the middle of the table. This fire will not be extinguished for a few rounds with players drawing a single card. You will need a total of 11 resources (2 metal, 4 plastic, and 5 waters) to capture this card and to put out this fire. While players are drawing cards to get that five point boost to their score, other fire cards may be drawn. When this occurs they are placed down onto the table. There are two five point fire cards, two four point fire cards, three three point fire cards, four two point fire cards, and five one point fire cards. If at any point, seven fire cards are placed onto the table, one of the players must put out a single fire without drawing any additional cards. If no one can, the game is over and the colony has burnt down and everyone loses. If you are able to get through the entire deck, then you know someone will win. You will need to reshuffle the cards and then it is a race to get the remaining cards to determine the overall winner.

--Chad Osborn (thedicehaveit)

181179.name: Ultima Forsan: A Taste of Macabre
181179.description:
From publisher blurb:

This document offers a sample of the Savage Setting Ultima Forsan for Savage Worlds. A setting book originally developed in Italian by Mauro Longo and Giuseppe Rotondo, Ultima Forsan is now being translated into English.

Inside this free sample you will find:

An introduction to the Macabre Renaissance
The setting rules to play the horrid Plague of the Dead
Death and the Machine: a complete adventure!
Four pregenerated Heroes, with sample new gear and new Edges
A selection of new creatures
A selection of inventions & technological marvels
Ultima Forsan unique character sheet




Welcome then to the Macabre Renaissance of Savage Worlds. One way or the other, once you get in, you will never be able to leave….

At the end of the Middle Ages, the Plague of the Dead has spread through Europe, Africa and Asia giving rise to the darkest time in history. Now, in the year 1514, heroes from the New Kingdoms are ready to fight to reconquer the World. Ultima Forsan is a game of wild adventures and deadly dangers, set in a macabre alternate version of our Renaissance.
Death is lurking, and each hour could be the last.
But you won’t give up.
Never.

181180.description:
(description from game publisher)

War has spread across the Inner Sphere, shattering and shifting alliances both old and new. As the Clans once more close in on humanity’s homeworld of Terra, the walls of Fortress have come down, revealing the return of Devlin Stone. Desperate for any edge, the Great Houses, Clans, and Periphery states of the Inner Sphere have unleashed a flood of new war machines, rushing them into battle on every front.


Technical Readout: 3150 collects the latest generation of battle armor, vehicles, ’Mechs, and aerospace units from around the Inner Sphere in a single print volume for the first time, complementing the Republic-heavy units shown in Technical Readout: 3145. Featuring new technologies found in Era Report: 3145 and Field Manual: 3145, with new variants and notable pilots, this volume provides players with a glimpse into the twilight years of the Dark Age Era.
181180.name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3150

181181.name: Cthulhu Dark Ages (2nd edition)
181181.description:
Publisher blurb:

Cthulhu Dark Ages is a world lit only by fire. The ancient empires collapsed centuries ago, taking their culture and learning with them. It’s [a] dark world and people are right to be afraid of the dark. Apart from the Viking raiders, witches, and outlaws, there are the unquiet dead, ancient horrors, and other malevolent beings stalking the countryside. Dark entities, beyond good and evil, wait hidden in the recesses of time and the angles of space. A few brave souls try their best to resist these horrors and push them back from whence they came. Will you be one of them?

Cthulhu Dark Ages has been updated for Call of Cthulhu 7th Edition, completely revised and with a wealth of new setting material. Included are a player’s guide to the Dark Ages, an optional Sanity mechanic which mirrors the medieval mindset, rules for the oral tradition of story telling, rules for mounted combat, a grimoire of Dark Age spells and optional rules for folk magic, a bestiary of monsters, as well as a fully detailed setting - the Anglo-Saxon community of Totburh in England’s Severn Valley which includes interesting characters, dwelling descriptions, and a multitude of plot hooks for Keepers to use and develop. In addition, three scenarios introduce players to the Dark Age Severn Valley.

181182.name: Good Night Fairy Theatre
181182.description:
User summary

Good Night Fairy Theatre is a light role-playing game where one player is a dreaming child and all the others are fairies trying to manipulate the child's dreams.

Good Night Fairy Theatre won the English Game-Chef competition in 2015

181183.name: Power Up! Jewel Thieves
181183.description: A two-player card game of cube placement to power up your abilities to steal gems from the supply and win by collecting gems or preventing your opponent from collecting them. A bit of take-that.

181184.name: Nusantara
181184.description:
In Nusantara, players try to build the largest archipelago. On each turn matching tiles are placed to build up their island chains to get the most poin (points) and win the game.

A turn consists of possibly placing a tile and moving their kano (canoe). Tiles can only be placed on areas where an island has been started or where a players kano is currently exploring.

Poin are tallied by completing islands. The Larger the island the more points its worth. After all tiles are laid, poin are added up and the player with the most poin becomes the Batara and wins the game.

181187.name: Pathways (Issue 50 - July 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in a Pit
20 Things to Find in a Sea Cave
The Secrets of the Divine: our Mother of Many Ways
Twenty Questions with Owen K.C. Stephens

181188.name: Mamono Raid
181188.description:
マモノレイド (Mamono Raid) is a party battle management game in which players control the attacks, healing, leveling-up, and item acquisition of their four-character parties as they battle the enemy Mamono. Each player begins with an identical party of a level-zero Warrior, Cleric, Sorceror, and Thief, but parties develop differently over time as players make skill- and item-purchasing decisions.

Players' parties work together to defeat the Mamono, a chimerical monster whose five-parted body changes randomly from game to game. Players compete, however, to obtain larger shares of the rewards for successfully destroying monster parts and, ultimately, more victory points then their fellow adventurers. Most games end with the Mamono's defeat, at which time the player with the most VPs wins.

A player's party has a single hit point count, which is both the party's life and its available action points. Individual characters do not die, whole parties do, and incur a victory point penalty. Damage dealt to the party is based on hate markers, which accrue to players in proportion to their success against the monster. Dealing more damage to the Mamono will mean greater incoming damage to manage. Key to victory is handling increasing damage while defeating the monster to earn VPs.

181189.name: UNCHARTED: The Nathan Drake Collection
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best PS4 Game Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
181189.description:
From the groundbreaking storytellers at Naughty Dog, comes the genre-defining epic that revolutionized adventure storytelling, rebuilt by Bluepoint Games with the power of the PS4 system. Experience one of the most revered game series of all time as you follow the perilous journey of Nathan Drake across the globe, from humble beginnings to extraordinary discoveries. Meet an unforgettable cast of characters as Drake puts life and friendship on the line in a race against ruthless enemies to uncover unimaginable treasure.

UNCHARTED The Nathan Drake Collection™ includes the single-player campaigns for UNCHARTED: Drake’s Fortune, UNCHARTED 2: Among Thieves, and UNCHARTED 3: Drake’s Deception. And UNCHARTED 4: A Thief’s End multiplayer Beta while the Beta is available.

Source: Game Website.

181190.name: Giallo
181190.description:
In Giallo, players compete to become the villain of their own classic horror movie.

2-4 players simultaneously choose to either raise the suspense, or murder a victim, striking at just the right moment to generate the most screams from the audience.

Each victim claimed grants new, unique powers, offering chances to disrupt other players and gain the lead, but hidden motives make some victims more valuable than others...

Whoever has accrued the most fear after five scenes becomes the true villain of the movie. The first player to win a trilogy of movies wins the game.

181192.description:
Description from the publisher:

Adventure with the Scarecrow and the Tin Woodsman! Brave the Poppy Fields or the Deadly Desert! Fight against a Wicked Witch or King Krewl! Visit the Emerald City and talk with Dorothy, Ozma, or the Cowardly Lion! Play a Professor, Royalty, Soldier ... or even a Wizard!

L. Frank Baum's Oz books have been favorites of children and their parents ever since the books were published over a century ago. Now you can create your own adventure with Munchkin Oz!
181192.name: Munchkin Oz

181193.description:
Crime Story is a fast-paced story-telling game where players together build fascinating criminal stories.

During the game players use cards depicting items, characters, places and actions. One after another, they build sentences to create the most consistent criminal story they can tell. A player who tells the sentence is called an AUTHOR. If the AUTHOR speaks out loudly sentence containing a word present on a card in other player's hand, the AUTHOR takes that card and puts it face up in front of him. This card gives him 1 point at the end of the game. A player who has the most points at the end of the game is a winner so during the game you should try to lead the story in a way that will protect cards that you have at your hand. Also be careful! There is a murderer among you. He tries to outrun others by getting additional points. Can you tell the best story and meanwhile hunt down the murderer?
181193.name: Crime Story

181194.name: Cucina Curiosa
181194.description:
The world-famous cruiser ship Costa Curiosa is sailing the seas, and as the head chef of the Cucina Curiosa — the restaurant aboard this cruiser — your honorable job is to serve the guests the most delectable foods possible. It's the last day of the journey, and the award-winning lobsters are waiting in their aquarium for their performance.

But all of a sudden, the alarm bell rings! The heavy sea tosses the ship about and mixes up all the kitchenettes. Even worse, the lobsters are able to flee from their aquarium! Catch them by getting the chaos under control, but avoid the slippery fishbones as they can quickly hold you back.

Cucina Curiosa is a fast-paced tile-laying game. Every player has the same set of twenty tiles, showing kitchenettes and paths. Some of the tiles also show lobsters and fishbones.

The game is played over sixteen turns. On every turn, the oldest player flips over one of his tiles, then the other players search for the same tile in their set, then everyone places the tile in his personal kitchen. Once sixteen tiles have been played, the game ends and players count their points. Every lobster that is connected to the entrance by paths is worth 1 point, but fishbones count negative for you, so you want to avoid them. The player with the most points wins!

181195.name: Bartnicy w lesie
181195.description: Bartnicy w lesie (Honey hunters) is a simple educational race game for children explaining and promoting the ancient art of honey hunting (traditional bee keeping in living trees). The educational value is added via random adventure cards the players can draw after landing on an adventure tile. The goal is to reach the forest meadow and collect as much honey as possible.

181196.description:
Munchkin Hipsters adds thirty new cards to any Munchkin standalone game that let you defy The Man while wearing your Knit Cap and sipping on your Nonfat Soy No-Whip Skinny Half-Caf Fair Trade Ventitré Mocha Latte. Even though it's so last year, you can fight the Indie Band using your Artisanal Chunky Black Glasses and go up a level when you Reject the Conventional.

Munchkin Hipsters was originally available exclusively through online retailer ThinkGeek, then released to the mass market in January 2016.
181196.name: Munchkin Hipsters

181197.name: Conquest At Kismet
181197.description:
In the Kismet Sector of the Raccroc Galaxy, huge self-sustaining motherships fight over control of the sector's vast natural resources. But you have to get past other races in order to obtain it. Hailed by its alpha testers as the Magic: The Gathering of sci-fi, this game breaks traditional card game mechanics and rearranges them into something that feels new and fresh!

In Conquest at Kismet, you play as one of two races vying for control of the Kismet sector in the Raccroc Galaxy. This simple game uses a lottery-like method of resolving battle, something that's never been used in a card game before. This allows for a very small table footprint while having a healthy mix of tactics and luck.

181198.description:
[STORY]
"Please defend the eggs!!"
Here is in another planet and somewhere in the continent.
A pair of dinosaur breed their eggs.
But evil birds named "fukouno-tori (unlucky-bird)" look down their eggs. These bird steel eggs and hide them.
And good birds named "kouno-tori (lucky-bird)" that are gentle bring back their hidden eggs.
It seems there is also another tribe that is a turf war around here.
Will they be able to defend successfully eggs?



[GAME CONTENT]
Tamamooool: Defend the Eggs is a 2 vs 2 partnership game.
Players have 4 cards in their hand and each turn a player plays a card from their hand.
Cards have two colors, one color for "fukouno-tori" (black) and another color for "kouno-tori" (white).
When a card is played, birds of the corresponding color move.
At the beginning of the player's turn, if any bird is in front of them, then their life (egg)( will increase or decrease.
The "fukouno-tori" (black birds) decrease their life, and "kouno-tori" (white birds) increase their life.There are 19 different birds, and players choose which birds to play while setting up the game.
There are many different combinations to choose from, and this drastically changes how the game is played!
You can choose easy set of birds for "beginners" players and more difficult (challenging) sets for "advanced" players.
181198.name: Tamamooool: Defend the Eggs

181199.name: Besieged
181199.description:
Besieged is a shed style card game for 2-4 players taking approximately 30 minutes after learning.

Players take the role of Commanders of an army retaliating against the villainous Agean Empire. The first to defeat three Agean officer cards wins the game. To do this, players take turns deploying legion cards that exceed the power level of the active card in play. Players have a set of Command Tokens they may spend on using a customizable set of abilities as well as playing cards.

When a player has played all the cards from their hand and Captain tableau, they can challenge Agean Officer cards.

181200.name: Wir suchen einen Parkplatz
181200.description: The first player to get all 3 cars on a parking spot wins the game. Movement is determinied by 2 dice. Even cars already on a parking spot can be forced to leave the parking spot by the roll of the dice. Each car that gets on a parking spot, gets a parking-ticket. The car is safe, if the ticket has a "0" on it. Every other number means, that the car has to leave the parking spot, if the player rolls the number on the parking ticket, while trying to park other cars.

181201.description:
This two-part expansion for Gothic Doctor augments the game in two ways.

First, it adds new patients to the game, with at least one new Legend in each patient class, additional copies of lower-value patients, and a new class of patients: demons. This class ranges from satanists and possessed children to legends like Dorian Gray.

Second, the expansion adds a new way to play the game: partial treatments. Instead of only curing one patient per turn, doctors can now perform four treatments per turn. Once a patient is cured, the doctor who performed the majority of treatments (or the last treatment in the case of a tie) earns the profit for that patient.
181201.name: Gothic Doctor: Demons & Partial Treatments Expansion

181202.name: Kreuz und quer
181202.description:
This game includes 24 Halma variants on one game board. Each variant is called by a female first name, like Jule or Lotte.
Each player has up to 42 playing pieces, which he has to get to the other side of the board. The center space can not be moved on or jumped over.

181204.name: Nefarious Nine (Part 3)
181204.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nefarious Nine - Part Three

Canada's worst villains have formed together to make a deadly villainous team called The Nefarious Nine! Split into three issues, this second issue features Mister Magician, Tamarack & Vicious.

181205.description:
A warm summer breeze sends ripples across the water as the sun begins to rise over Lake Kegonsa--It’s a great day for fishing!

In Kegonsa players are competing in a local fishing tournament and must carefully manage the assortment of lures and special equipment in their tackle boxes while scoping out the best spots in the lake in order to out-fish their opponents.

At the start of each game, the lake tiles are shuffled and laid face-up in a grid of variable size depending on the number of players. Each lake tile depicts 1 to 3 fish that players are trying to catch during the game by placing the highest value of like-colored lures around them. A player’s turn consists of two phases: movement and placement. In the movement phase, players must move their boat token 1 or 2 spaces to a new unoccupied lake tile. In the placement phase, players must select an available lure tile from their tackle box using a unique rondel mechanic and place it adjacent to the location of their boat. After a set number of rounds, each of the lake tiles is scored and the player who caught the highest value of fish is the winner!
181205.name: Kegonsa

181206.name: Odin Sphere Leifthrasir
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Heroine of the Year Nominee
181206.description:
User Summary

Odin Sphere: Leifdrasir is a remake of the original.

181207.name: Phydea Campaign Setting
181207.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to the world of Phydea, a large planet housing many civilizations, fantastic creatures, and endless adventure. This world is made up of two main continents, Macea and Archaea, both separated by a vast sea dotted with thousands of islands. The cultures found here use ancient technologies that generally conform to the Late Bronze Age on Earth. In fact, this world is a kind of alternate-Earth, where many things are similar to our own world; much of the plant and animal life, minerals, climate, technology and peoples are very similar to those found on Earth in the Late Bronze Age.

181208.name: Ave
181208.description:
In Ave (Ah-Vay), each player represents a powerful Roman General, Senator, Noble, or Priestess battling for favor in the Emperor's court. Using deceit, backstabbing, diplomacy, or simple violence, rise to the top and annihilate your rivals.

Ave is a fast-paced competitive card game for 2-4 players.

Ave is a great game for the casual or hardcore gamer, as it's simple mechanics are complimented by a huge variety of card effects that change the game in an incredibly fluid way. Actions are played, countered, and diverted, secret cards are revealed and plans are hatched.

Combined with 8 unique character cards that give players special abilities and alternate paths to victory, and you've got a game that never plays the same way twice. This is a competitive card game in a single box!

181209.description:
This entry is for the Kickstarter edition with additional content in the box. Limited content consists of 55 cards and a Kickstarter Limited Guide.

Kickstarter Limited cards are: 18 regular enemy cards (6 blue, 6 green and 6 red), 2 special enemy cards, 18 encounter and 2 special encounter cards, 13 time cards, and 2 quest info cards.

Kickstarter Limited Guide includes two additional quests (V: Crusade of the Fallen, and VI: Old Grievances) and a chapter: "the Story of Mistfall continues" which gives flavour to the quests included.

Limited cards have a text at the bottom saying: enemy pack/quest pack/tough times/encounter pack LIMITED. They are numbered 386 - 440.


Mistfall is a fully co-operative adventure game set in a fantasy world of mystery, eldritch powers and high adventure.

At the start of the game each player chooses a hero with a fixed deck of equipment and power cards, before embarking on a dangerous journey through a set of monster-ridden locations. Each hero also comes with a pool of advanced abilities that can be added to their basic deck during the game to customize and expand their powers. A variable board setup, randomized encounters and enemies, a simple but robust monster AI – all that makes for a game that is a varied and challenging experience both solitaire as well as with a group of up to three friends.

Gather up your resolve, check your gear and get ready to brave the unrelenting Mists. A world of perilous adventures awaits!
181209.name: Mistfall: Kickstarter Edition

181210.name: Lone Killers of the Southwest
181210.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five deadly real-life gunmen stalked the Wild West. This feature details five of 'em: Clay Allison, Black Bart, John Wesley Hardin, Deacon Jim Miller, and Dave Rudabaugh. Each one has their history, stats, and Story Seeds, all ready for your Deadlands campaign!

181211.name: Psionics Unleashed Revised
181211.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tap into the mysteries of psionics, using sheer force of will to allow psionic characters to let loose power to rival any physical force or magical energy. Revised and updated with brand new artwork and formatting, including fully-developed 0-level psionic powers, Psionics Unleashed Revised has all of the material from the original Psionics Unleashed, but with the production quality our fans deserve, as well as the forgeborn and noral races. In this book, you will find the secrets of psionics, the magic of the mind.

Contained within the pages of Psionics Unleashed Revised you will find:

Four 20-level psionic base classes: the psion, psychic warrior, soulknife, and wilder
Nine psionic prestige classes, including the elocater and the thrallherd
Ten psionic races to create new characters, from the blue, to the elan, to the serpentine ophiduan.
Dozens of psionic feats for psionic characters of all classes
Hundreds of psionic powers, ranging from precognition to reality revision, and 0-level talents
Psionic monsters including the nefarious phrenic scourge and the deadly thought slayer




Updated to support the rules of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, Psionics Unleashed Revised contains everything needed to easily integrate psionics into any campaign, including characters, items, monsters, and powers.

181213.description: 15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck. This deck features several new Immediate Actions including Pinch Runner, Hit & Run, and Sinkerball.
181213.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Big Fly! Expansion

181214.description: 15 new cards for the Free Agent Deck. This deck features several new Immediate Actions including Error, Wild Pitch, Contact and Bean Ball.
181214.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Errors! Expansion

181215.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 10 Baltimore
181215.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 10 Baltimore (V2) - Veteran Mix 2.

181216.name: Crag Lurker
181216.description:
Publisher blurb:

In the reaches of high crags swept by hot winds, the crag lurker lies in wait. A fierce reptilian predator, it does not discriminate between herd and herdsman, but will feast on both without hesitation. Those who would cross the warm, dry peaks and buttes of the deserts and scrublands must steel themselves against these monsters.

Mountain Terrors: Crag Lurker is a bestiary PDF for the Chronicle System, the rules engine that powers our popular A Song of Ice & Fire Roleplaying game.

181217.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 11 Cincinnati
181217.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 11 Cincinnati (V3) - Veteran Mix 3.

181218.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 12 Detroit
181218.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 12 Detroit (V4) - Veteran Mix 4.

181219.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 13 Kansas City
181219.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 13 Kansas City (V5) - Veteran Mix 5.

181220.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 14 Philadelphia
181220.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 14 Philadelphia (V6) - Veteran Mix 6.

181221.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 15 Pittsburgh
181221.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 15 Pittsburgh (V7) - Veteran Mix 7.

181222.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 16 Texas
181222.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 16 Texas (V8) - Veteran Mix 8.

181223.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 5 Chicago
181223.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 5 Chicago (V5) - Veteran Mix 5.

181224.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 6 St Louis
181224.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 6 St Louis (V6) - Veteran Mix 6.

181225.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 7 Florida
181225.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 7 Florida (V7) - Veteran Mix 7.

181226.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 8 Milwaukee
181226.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 8 Milwaukee (V8) - Veteran Mix 8.

181227.name: Baseball Highlights: 2045 – Starter Team 9 Atlanta
181227.description: 15 new cards for Baseball Highlights: 2045: Starter Team 9 Atlanta (V1) - Veteran Mix 1.

181228.description:
Just when you were starting to relax around your fellow thieves, crooks and criminals comes More Cash 'n More Guns, an expansion for Ca$h 'n Guns that'll have you looking over your shoulder long after the police sirens have faded.

In this expansion, you can get your hands on four new pistols, new loot cards and new special powers. The simple act of robbing a bank has never been more fun!
181228.name: Ca$h 'n Guns (Second Edition): More Cash 'n More Guns
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 011 – Blood Rage vs El Grande
Ep 38 Q&A
Episode 2 - Star Wars Special And Imperial Assault Review
MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen

181229.name: Firewall
181229.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Firewall is a secret organization sourcebook for both Eclipse Phase players and gamemasters.

It includes:

Details on Firewall’s history, organization, and ongoing operations.
Firewall’s notable people, locations, and internal factions.




Rival organizations, including the argonauts, Jovians, Titanians, and ultimates.

New traits, gear, and 16 sample characters

181230.name: Real Time Tower Defense
181230.description:
The Darkness looms and your master is the only one who can banish it. It will take him 4 days. You, his apprentices, must defend him till he has finished casting his spell or be forever plunged into darkness. Your only hope is to build the powerful arcane defenses handed down to you by your master; Powerful towers. Time is of the essence.

Real Time Tower Defense is a real time co-operative boardgame for 2-4 players that plays in under 60 minutes. In what is a true tower defense game, players (the Apprentices) build towers to defend their base from the hordes of mindless monsters besieging them and survive 4 “Days” (Having at least 1 Team Health left without going below 1 at any point during the game). The game is played in real time, increasing the tension, giving players just enough time to do what they need to without overwhelming them. The game is run to a sound track which prompts players through the game (much like Space Alert or Escape but somewhere in between). There is a break between each “Day” giving players time to plan for the next while the difficulty of the game increases. Players also gather resources and build their towers in real time using a sand timer, meaning there are two aspects of the game competing for attention. Forget about one of these aspects and you will lose the game.

181231.name: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide
rpghonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
rpgissuearticle: Travel Talk: The Dessarin River Valley
181231.description:
From the back cover:

WELCOME TO THE SWORD COAST

A region of the Forgotten Realms®, the Sword Coast comprises shining paragons of civilization and culture, perilous locales fraught with dread and evil, and encompassing them all, a wilderness that offers an explorer both vast opportunity and great danger.

The Sword Coast Adventurer’s Guide is a valuable resource for Dungeon Masters and players alike. In addition to describing the peoples and places of the Sword Coast, the book contains a plethora of new character options to intrigue and inspire every adventuring party.

181232.name: Rended Press: The Semi-Good Stuff, 2011-2012
181232.description:
From Introduction:
Being a miscellany of material for gonzo-flavored old school-style role playing games.

User Summary:
Eight magic items; one spell; fourteen random tables; twenty questions (with answers); and The 2,000 Coin Dungeon

181233.name: Rationality Cardinality
181233.description:
Rationality Cardinality consists of two types of cards, Question cards and Answer cards. Each round, one player is the judge; they draw a Question card and read it to the other players, who pick one of the ten Answer cards from their hand and play it face down. One random card is added to serve as the control player, and the cards are shuffled together. The judge reads the cards and picks their favorite, and the player who submitted it gets a point.

The cards themselves are part nerd humor and part teaching material: they take concepts from rationality, philosophy, economics, and other fields, make them into jokes, and provide captions to explain the meaning.

181234.description:
The Fight against Smaug gets harder with this new rule. The power of the dragon's shield is rolled by dice.
1-6 = The rolled power must be exactly achieved by the player's cards.
181234.name: Der Hobbit: Smaugs Einöde – Smaug: Die Mini-Erweiterung

181235.description:
Sator Arepo Tenet Opera Rotas: Malleus Maleficarum, a new version of Sator Arepo Tenet Opera Rotas, appears seven years after the original game and it contains the new Malleus Maleficarum expansion.

In Sator Arepo Tenet Opera Rotas, players must use their cards to move and rotate footbridges and create paths where their monks can move to recover the lost books. Each player also has their own set of Liber Fidei cards that allow them to perform special moves. Each such card can be used only once per game. The first player to recover all their books wins.

The Malleus Maleficarum expansion adds a new set of rules in which players can discard cards during other player's turns to move the ghost of the Black Monk on the board. The ghost curses every player it meets during its wandering in the ancient room. Players can also decide to gain curses to play their Malleus Maleficarum cards, which are very powerful, but beware: Curses cause players to play with fewer action points or fewer cards!
181235.name: Sator Arepo Tenet Opera Rotas: Malleus Maleficarum

181236.description:
The castle is besieged! Hordes of monsters gather near the ancient walls and are about to smash open the castle gates. Mountain giants trample the fields, fire riders burn the surrounding settlements, and the ice dragon has nested on top of the citadel tower, horrifying the minds of the inhabitants of the bastion. Only a squad of stubborn heroes stands between the enemies and their ultimate victory.

Bastion is a cooperative castle defense game set in the Berserk universe, with 1 to 4 players taking on the roles of magical castle defenders. The castle is located in the center of the game board and is menaced by a great variety of invading enemies: dangerous beasts, ferocious warriors, terrible monsters, giants, mages, and even mighty dragons.

You will travel the bastion districts, draw energy from sources of magic, build obelisks, bombard the enemies by magical devices and learn new spells. You will be gathering specific mana that is required to defeat each of the invaders. Victories allow castle defenders to gain new abilities, build powerful artifacts, and perform magic rituals.

To defeat a monster you usually must travel to its location and spend a specific amount of mana of a required color. Each defeated monster provides you with a new spell. The tougher the defeated enemy, the better spell you will get. Castle defenders should try to be as efficient as possible. If you take too many actions to defeat your threats, the bastion will fall.

Bastion is a cooperative adventure: you either defend the city by concerted efforts or it will fall under the pressure of the attacking hordes. Bastion is a highly customizable and replayable game. There are several scenarios and difficulty settings in the rules, along with the solo mode.
181236.name: Bastion

181237.name: Brunost, Langrenn og Lusekofte
181237.description:
An entertaining game on how to behave like a "typical Norwegian".


When you are abroad do you boast of Norwegian pop groups that you really do not like?
Do you think a stranger must be crazy for asking to sit beside you when there are other vacant seats on the bus?
Have you ever turned over to Swedish television when Norway beats Sweden in cross country skiing, just to hear the Swedish television commentators?


If you answer "yes" to any of these questions, you have very good chances succeeding in this game.
