181345.description: The brilliant Dr. Eureka has important experiments for you to complete! You must solve his scientific formulas by mixing the molecules from tube to tube without touching them with your bare hands. Transfer your molecules faster than your competition in Dr. Eureka to prove you're the smartest scientist in the lab...
181345.name: Dr. Eureka
boardgamepodcastepisode: 44 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Hosting a Game Night
Episode 26 - The Must Play Two Player Games of 2016…as of June
Episode 27: Tiny Epic Almes
Episode 51 - Adventure Land
Low Player Count - Ep 24 - Card Drafting
The Game Pit: Episode 76 - Picking Over the Bones Family Edition
Vox Republica 118: A Quarriors Qretrospective
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 75

181346.name: Takoashi University: Work Study
181346.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

181347.name: Takoashi University: School Band
181347.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

181348.name: Takoashi University: Marie-Claude
181348.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

181349.name: Takoashi University: Fitness Club
181349.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

181350.name: Takoashi University: Dodgeball
181350.description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

181351.description:
Pro Religione et Libertate (PRL) is an operational level wargame expansion for Red Sash Games' 2010 title Remember Limerick! The latter covers the war between King James II and King William III in Ireland, from 1689-1691. PRL expands the game to cover the Dutch invasion of England in 1688 (a.k.a. the Glorious Revolution) and the fighting in Scotland that took place in parallel with the war in Ireland, 1689-1692.

PRL belongs to Red Sash Games' Lace Wars series of 17th and 18th Century operational wargames and uses the same scales (units are battalions and regiments, map distances are 4 leagues per hex, turns are 3 weeks each).

PRL has scenarios for 2 players. These allow the players to fight the invasion of 1688 and the Scottish campaign. When combined with Remember Limerick! up to 4 people can play. There are 2 campaign scenarios, one starting in 1688 and one in 1689.
181351.name: Pro Religione et Libertate

181352.name: Golem Arcana: Urugal Expansion – Cabal of the Onyx Cliffs
181352.description:
Craftet from the bones of monstrosities of ages past, Urugal Golems prowl the battlefield to claim the skeletons of their enemies.

Three new Golems for your Golem Arcana Army, the Urugal.

181353.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: U.S.A
181353.description:
From the publisher's website:
l 6 Giugno 1944 i Morti trascinarono il mondo nel più oscuro degli inferni. Nel Giorno dei Tre Soli New York e Washington D.C. vennero rase al suolo dalla potenza delle bombe atomiche.
Adesso è il 1957, grazie al Butoprofene Acilato l'incubo dei Morti Affamati è solo un lontano ricordo. Gli Stati Uniti d'America stanno entrando in una nuova era di pace, benessere e sicurezza. Eppure qualcuno percepisce una realtà diversa.
In alcune zone il Sud sta risorgendo, sotto il controllo dei bianchi cappucci del Klu Klux Klan mentre nella Città Libera di New Orleans culture diverse si mischiano e si inchinano alla magia del Vudù, creatrice di Zombi. Il resto dell'America è un luogo devastato, selvaggio e ricco di misteri, dove i Radioattivi portano violenza e morte, e dove creature senza nome marciano senza sosta.

181354.name: Tentacle Bento: Foil Pack
181354.description: New recruits have arrived to Takoashi University. Increase the mayhem in your games of Tentacle Bento with this 19 card, holofoil expansion pack. Including events, characters, all-stars, and students, every holofoil card in this expansion pack features unique art to make your games more colorful than ever!

181355.description:
1863 is a two player wargame of a pivotal year in the American Civil War. 1863 saw the Union victories at Gettysburg in the east and Vicksburg in the west, and the Chattanooga-Chickamauga campaigns when the Confederates had the opportunity to win a decisive battle and potentially gain foreign recognition.

Each player commands one of the two Theater of Operations; East and West. What makes this game unique is that one player commands the Union in the Eastern Theater, and the Confederates in the Western Theater; the second commands the Union in the Western Theater, and the Confederates in the Eastern Theater. Both players are competing to gain the most Victory Points in each Theater while defeating their opponent on the other.

The objective of each player is to score the most Victory Points in terms of seizing critical cities and winning battles. The idea is that you are positioning yourself for a major promotion for total command of all your side's armies for the rest of the war. Units represent corps, divisions and individual leaders with their staffs. Each turn is one month.

181356.name: Reign of Man
181356.description:
In Reign of Man, 2-5 players are emperors that battle one another while managing their empire until one emerges as the victor who will forever rule the world! Each emperor raises and moves armies in order to control more empires, or clusters of territories. They will develop their society in order to gain special abilities and victory points. The moment a player has 3 victory points, they win! The moment you have no armies on the board, you are out of play. Will you be Lord Protector, Warlord or Great Reformer?

Each turn, you'll choose one action to take from those unlocked on your empire mat. At the beginning you'll either raise an army, move an army or improve one of the development ranks on your ship mat. These ranks will grant new and more powerful abilities which you can choose from during subsequent turns. Agriculture advancements will allow you to raise more armies and better defend your lands - you'll also earn a victory point for a high rank in agriculture. Military allows more troop deployments and the ability to gain victory points for each completed set of territories you control. Finally, there's Civilization. You will eventually gain a victory point for civilization, but the real gem of this category is being able to take multiple actions each turn. Once a player has achieved three victory points, they win and the game is over.

World events kind of throw a wrench in the best laid plans. You can see what is going to happen three turns in advance. This allows you to better plan to take advantage of global events.

You'll quickly get to a point where you are watching other players and acting against their strategies. You can keep a high military kingdom from receiving its victory points or keep highly civilized kingdoms from taking extra actions by breaking up their empire. A well placed strike can have lasting effects. But, it's costly to you because at the very least it takes your turn.

Did you notice what I never mentioned? Money. There's no fiddly money mechanic. No huge army bum-rushing. No tedious marching of vast armies across huge masses of territories. Reign of Man takes the best parts of the best war games of the past and leaves all the good stuff. Check it out! And may the world kneel to the one true emperor!

181358.description:
Enhanced money set for '1835' and other games.

Contents:
40 @ 1 30 @ 20
15 @ 4 20 @ 50
20 @ 5 24 @ 100
30 @ 10 14 @ 500

Total Value 12,000

comment
no year for this product is available
the game was published in 1990
this accessory may not have been available since 1995 or earlier
181358.name: 1835 Extension Kit MEK 1: Enhanced Money

181360.name: Wertvolle Schätze
181360.description: Wertvolle Schätze (Precious Treasures) is a tile laying game, presenting 20 treasures named in the Bible. Numbered tiles are drawn from a bag. On your turn, you place one tile or change one for a new one from the bag. To make a discovery, place the L-shaped tiles around a treasure, matching the numbers and placing black and white numbers alternating. The player who places the fourth, last tile around a treasure gets it. Whoever gets five treasures first, wins.

181361.name: Ett ölspel
181361.description:
400 entertaining questions and answers about beer.

A player throw a die that show the different categories and try to answer correct and score points.

boardgameimplementation: Super Dungeon Explore: Candy and Cola
boardgamecompilation: Super Dungeon Explore: Boo Booty Box
181362.description:
The legendary Hero, Candy, has battled her way across the length and breadth of Crystalia. Skill is nothing without courage. Fortunately, Brave-Mode Candy possesses courage aplenty, and her bravery is a bright light to all who join her.

Brave-Mode Candy also replaces Super Dungeon Explore: Candy and Cola from the first edition of Super Dungeon Explore and contains a hero card for Soda Master Candy, which can be used with either model.

Contents

Brave-Mode Candy Assembled Model
Never-Lost Cola Assembled Model
Brave-Mode Candy Hero Card
Soda Master Candy Hero Card
Never-Lost Cola Pet Card
Never-Lost Cola Treasure Card
181362.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Brave-Mode Candy

181363.name: El Diablo
181363.description:
In El Diablo, players have to bet on the number of tricks they expect to achieve and then do it!

The cards are numbered from 1 to 15, the fifteen being the strongest, but we must take into account the special cards:

El Diablo can take the value of zero or sixteen up to you.
The Chameleon allows you to take the value of a card played or play
The Wizard allows you to vary the value of a card from another player!




In El Diablo tension mounts, mounts for fast and animated parts, it is the devil who wants that!

181365.name: Pondemonium
181365.description:
Pondemonium is a free print'n'play fantasy wargame for two players, where frogs and turtles fight over the control of a Pond.
The game Pondemonium is based on the Eureka Miniatures "Pond Wars" range.
This ruleset adds various components (all free to download to print'n'play) that make the game similiar to classic boardgames, the player can either use the fantastic miniatures from Eureka or the print'n'play version of them.
The gameplay revolves around the turtles and frogs armies: the first must defend the pond with its better defensive ability, while the second must surround the enemies and conquer the pond with its major number of troops and its mobility.
The main mechanics of this game are: action points represented as cards, movement based on how much terrain is
crossed, and d6 rolling for battling.

BACKGROUND
Since the beginning of time, the Dark Frond Swamp has been a theater for battles between Frogs and Turtles. While Turtles live in an empire based on manpower and industrial development, Frogs are ruled by an Evil King that assures the wellness of his reign through war and conquests. For ages Turtles were forced to rise the level of their military tactics to defend the borders from the brute force of the Frog army. Battle after battle, Turtle defenses weakened, giving Frogs a great opportunity. Now the Frog King is coming, with new technological warfare machines. The next assault could create a direct passage to the Turtle land. The time is right, and unexpected: Turtles are not warned about the Frogs arrival. Will the heroic captain Cracked Shell prevail even in this desperate battle?

181368.name: Golem Arcana: Zikia – Heralds of the Great Weald
181368.description:
The outriders for the Zikia tribes, these Golems herald the uprising of The Zikia Great Weald. Harnessing the fury of a thousand tribes they bring vengeance to the Zikia's enemy.

Three new Golems for your Golem Arcana Army.

181369.name: Die Börse
181369.description: The players move around the board, while buying and selling shares of public corporations. Movement is determined by a die. Three special dies determine the share prices and dividends. If a the stock rises, dividends are payed to the share holders. If a player has at least 6 shares of a company, he has to buy this company. As a result he, instead of the bank, has to pay the dividends. But he also gets 10 times the dividend from players who land on one of the spaces of his company. The game Ends when one player gets bankrupt or if the bank runs out of money. The Player with the most capital (money, shares, companies) wins the game.

181370.description:
A simultaneous 2 player game of surviving the apocalypse all in 5 to 10 minutes.

It’s a nice day in Meepleton. You & friends are enjoying the day without a care in the world . . .
BOOM! Transformers blow, cars crash, people fall to the ground unconscious. Phew! You’re wobbly but okay.
RAWR! Nearby a giant, heinous monster wreaks havoc!
Get your friends to the school's forgotten fallout shelter.

Game Setup

Dump out tin, choose a color, place 4 meeps laying down & 1 standing on your side of tin.
Grab matching dice.
Tin is the Fallout Shelter (FoS).
Stand monster a few inches from FoS with green die behind it, 6 facing up.
Place 2 white supply boxes between the FoS & nefarious monster.

Game Play
Get your meeps to their feet, stay on yours, secure the FoS, get 1 supply box & seal the FoS!
Your actions are on 7s & you need 1 standing meep to help your single meeps or to knock down others.
FoS holds a max of 7 meeps.
Start game & roll your dice. Standard game is simultaneous rolling, not turn-based.
On a 7 you can:

Stand 1 meep (if none standing)
Help 1 meep to its feet
Help 1 standing meep into FoS
Knock down 1 standing opponent
Toss 1 opponent out of FoS (you need 1 in) BUT place them standing up outside FoS
Send out RECON PAIR from the FoS to get 1 supply box
Stand 1 knocked down meep in RECON PAIR
Knock down 1 meep in RECON PAIR
Drag 1 supply box into FoS with standing RECON PAIR
Seal FoS – Close lid with at least 4 of your meeps in & 1 supply box for the WIN!




What about the monster?

Three game modes – Decide before you start: UHOH or OMG or CRA-CRA!

UHOH activates monster die as soon as a supply box gets into the FoS. This is standard play. Once activated, player rolling doubles of monster die’s face-up number has to turn monster die down 1. A double 6 turns monster die to 5, a double 5 turns it to 4 & so on. When monster die is on 1, snake eyes (double 1s) ends game. Monster gets in FoS & eats you! BUT . . . either player can be a hero by tossing 1 of their outside standing meeps onto monster die! That meep is forever gone (but not forgotten). However, next double 1s ends the game unless another jumps on. Sacrificing a meep doesn’t need a 7 & can be done in or out of FoS but only when monster die is on 1.
OMG mode activates monster die when the game starts. Faster game but it sucks to be human.
181370.name: Mint Tin Mini Apocalypse
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 21: Steam Works And Duel Lists

181371.name: human(ish)
181371.description:
From the PDF Introduction

human(ish) is a game of modern supernatural horror, where the player characters are the monsters. They are the Vampires, Werewolves and Ghosts that give rise to modern and ancient legends and haunt the darkness.

This is a game about confronting the monster and the darkness inside everyone.

There are various supernatural types described in this book that can be used as player characters, and a description of various ways that the game can be played.

From the Back of the Book

In the dark of the night, strange things lurk and howl. The supernatural are not just stories to frighten unruly children or provide a plot for a cheap movie, they are real!

And what is worse, not only are they supernatural, but they are also human. Well, human(ish) anyway.

This is a roleplaying game about being those creatures. It is about reconciling what you were with what you are. It is about facing up to the monster inside. It is a game of action and interaction. It is whatever sort of game you want it to be.

This complete game contains rapid and uncomplicated character creation, fast action resolution and beyond human adventures, and is everything you need to play except some dice.

Explore the dark side...

181372.description: Coup: Guatemala 1954 – Anarchy, an expansion for La Mame Games' Coup: Guatemala 1954, adds seven new roles and actions to that game for more vicious fun: Anarchists, Paramilitary, Arms Dealers, Freedom of press, World Bank, Plantation owners, and Socialists.
181372.name: Coup: Rebellion G54 – Anarchy
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 019 – I, Geek Interviews Rikki Tahta

181373.name: Smiles: A Game of Shells
boardgameversion: Smiles: A Game of Shells- Pouch edition
181373.description: The perfect blend of luck,skill and strategy. Players roll cowrie shells in their attempt to get the shells to land smile side up. You are allowed up to 3 rolls per turn and you can roll any or all of your shells each turn. The strategy increases as scoring points becomes more difficult and penalties and bonuses apply.

181375.name: Pyrkon: Atak Koziołaków!
181375.description:
Pyrkon: Atak Koziołaków is a modified version of the Mafia, enriching the game with a lot of interesting characters that have a genuine skills.
The action takes place at Multigenre Fan Convention Pyrkon.

181376.description:
You are a soon-to-be-famous gnome scientist helping to map the gnome GNA. Teamwork is the best way to advance your research, but gnomes are naturally grumpy and uncooperative, and besides only one scientist can win the Gnobel prize.

G.Nome is an innovative partnership game in which you have to balance working together to beat the other teams, while staying ahead of your partner.

GAMEPLAY

G.Nome is very simple and fast with a tight tactical decision in card play where most of the time you are working closely with your partner against the rival team(s) but at crucial moments you are also trying to out-negotiate and out-think your own partner.

The core mechanic of G.Nome is you are competing on projects to earn research results(colored cards) that are up for grabs each turn. The game lasts 8 rounds. Everyone starts with a hand of 9 Teamwork cards (1-9) and each turn plays one card that will indicate how much effort you are going to put into the project, and consequently what order you will get to choose the research cards on offer. Teamwork cards are chosen and revealed simultaneously. If both team members play the same card they automatically lose ! Then Teammates add up their total teamwork effort for the Team Total, and the Team with the highest Total chooses first with the player in that team who played the highest card taking the pick and keeping it for himself. Then the lowest card player in the losing team goes next. So if you care about the cards on offer you either want to persuade your partner to play high (and play higher than him) or persuade him to go low (and go lower than him) but never risk playing the same card as him.

At it's best G.Nome is for 4 players with each game having a change of partners and the highest cumulative score winning overall.
181376.name: G.Nome
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 012 – Essen 2015 Highlights Show
Ep 019 – I, Geek Interviews Rikki Tahta

181377.description:
The 1920s — a time that is often referred to as the "Roaring Twenties", a boisterous period characterized by rapidly changing lifestyles, financial excesses, and the fast pace of technological progress. In 1919, the requisite number of legislatures of the States ratified the 18th Amendment to the Federal Constitution, enabling national Prohibition within one year of ratification. Prohibition began on January 16, 1920 when the Eighteenth Amendment went into effect. During this time, the sale, manufacture, and transportation (a.k.a. bootlegging) of alcoholic beverages was illegal throughout the United States. Federal Prohibition agents were given the task of enforcing the law. Even though the sale of alcohol was illegal, alcoholic drinks were still widely available at "speakeasies" and other underground drinking establishments.

Welcome to the Opulent, a posh speakeasy located in vibrant Atlantic City! In The Opulent 1-4 players are tasked with the operations of a successful nightclub during the historic Jazz Age. Each player takes on a distinct role that plays a vital part in the success — or failure — of the Opulent. Cater to the recognizable social classes of the 1920s. Politicians, mobsters, aristocrats, and social celebrities are all seeking a grand time in your club. Entertain your patrons with upbeat jazz tempos, or melodic waltzes, with the Opulent jazz band. Fancy the illegal indulgences of your patrons by preparing them an exotic mixed drink, a good whisky on the rocks, or even a simple brew. Pay lookouts to deter Federal Agents seeking to shut the club down. Hire flappers, a chanteuse, cocktail waitress, or other helpful hands and amenities to improve your club.

Manage the Opulent in ten scenarios dating from 1920-1929 during one of the most historic periods of U.S. history! Each scenario has a dollar value that is associated with the cost of operating The Opulent for that particular year. Players must have enough money in the club coffers to cover this cost in order to win the scenario if playing a single session game, or to progress to the next scenario if players are taking on the Opulent campaign.

With a focus on theme and history, "The Opulent" is a light cooperative asymmetrical game set during 1920's prohibition where players operate a campaign driven upscale speakeasy.
181377.name: The Opulent
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 097 - Bottom of the 9th & Baseball Highlights 2045
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 013 – Gaming Events
OBG 175: Preview Party

181378.name: Falling Clowns
181378.description: Falling Clowns is "an exciting balancing game for up to 4 players." In this dexterity game, players take turns hanging their plastic clowns on a central clown. Players start with six clowns each. Clowns must be balanced on the stack using one hand only, and must be hooked on to one of five projections (arms, legs, head) by one of the five holes (mouth, legs, button holes). Any clown that touches the table must be taken back by the placing player. If hanging a clown causes multiple clowns to fall, all those clowns must be added to the placing player's supply. The first player to add all his or her clowns on the stack wins.

181379.description:
The Vampire Lord has entered the Castle and is slowly infecting everyone to take control. The Lady and her Hero are pure of heart and can resist him for a while, but they have only one night to find him and one chance to kill him when the sun rises.

In Vampire Panic, (which is possibly not the game's final name), all players are dealt a character card, with one player starting as the Vampire Lord. Players trade cards in two rounds of play and may secretly become infected. The vampires will attempt to infect as many humans as they can while concealing their identity, while the surviving humans are trying to identify the location of the Vampire Lord by the end of the night.

Vampire Panic is a light social deduction game that attempts to combine the hidden roles and fast play of Akihisa Okui's One Night Werewolf with the tense infection mechanism of David Ausloos's Panic Station.
181379.name: Vampire Panic

181380.description:
This is a special set of 8 playable cards available to BGG users that become fans of Shadows of Malice. The cards are:

1. Treasure card: Cache of Shards. Avatars find 3d3 randomly colored and colorless soulshards
2. Treasure card: Cache of Potions. Avatars find 2d3 random potions (better be banded for this one!)
3. Fate card: Caller of the Wild. (Invoked) Avatar may choose creature type for encounter from those available for terrain
4. Fate card: Stormy weather. (Instant) Avatar's band suffer 50% movement reduction
5. Ability card: Firekin. Creature delivers +1d* fire wounds, gets +1d* fire shield, suffers +1 wound received from cold
6. Ability card: Frostkin. Creature delivers +1d* cold wounds, gets +1d* cold shield, suffers +1 wound received from fire
7. Ability card: Levikin. Creature delivers +1d* electricity wounds, gets +1d* electricity shield, suffers +1 wound received from acid
8. Ability card: Acrikin. Creature delivers +1d* acid wounds, gets +1d* acidshield, suffers +1 wound received from electricity
181380.name: Shadows of Malice: BGG Fan Card Set

181381.name: Occultism
181381.description:
From the back of the book:

This Shadows of Esteren add-on, intended for Game Leaders, focuses on occultism. Who are the representatives of this strange science? How are they organized? What do they seek? Beside the mystical powers of the Demorthèn and of the priests of the Temple, is there another source of supernatural power? In exploring these questions, the Characters will face mysteries that may shake their innermost convictions!

Contents include:

- Occultism in Tri-Kazel
This introductory chapter is a complete overview of occultism in Tri-Kazel. Leaders will find many details about the skills of occultists, the forbidden arts of sorcerers, or the mysterious visionary powers of mediums. New Disciplines are introduced, as well as additional rules on sanity.

- The Circle of Emergence
The second chapter describes a characteristic occult organization: its modes of operation, its objectives, and its core members. Whether the Circle of Emergence is intended to become the PC's patron or their mortal enemy, this game aid is certain to be valuable for Leaders who wish to bring occultism to the forefront of their campaign.

- A Tidy Room
When a young girl from a low-class district, enchanting and beloved by all, disappears, the locals are in a commotion. Searches are quickly organized: people comb through vacant lots, back streets and dumping grounds. Even the sewers and canals are explored over the course of several days... to no avail. "A Tidy Room" is a large scenario written by Iris that will confront the Player Characters with occult and supernatural dangers. It comes with many game aids, including a comprehensive description of the scenario's locale: the Weavers' Disctrict, a perfect setting for any game in an urban environment. Finally two new creatures are included: the Bogeyman and the Diwelank.

181382.description:
Quantum physics tells us ‘the ability of quantum particles to occupy two states seemingly at once could be explained by both states co-existing in different universes’. So when you wave goodbye to your ship in your universe, someone else waves goodbye to their ship in a different parallel universe. But what would happen if these neighboring universes, separated by the thinnest, gossamer barrier should somehow be breached and my ship sails into your world and searches for gold in competition to your ship? Play the game and find out...

Niña & Pinta is a game of exploration of the New World where the great nations of Spain, England, France and Portugal send ships out to map the unknown and to bring home wealth to the Old World. This is a game where those ships will cross the divide and where no love is lost between Captains no matter which world it is! Explore, settle, fight if need be, and help your nation develop its Culture, Science, Religion and War-craft, to be the best in all worlds!

No dice rolling in this Ragnar game, but plenty of tension as players can launch offensives with their Captains after first using them to flip land tiles thereby exploring each New World. Settlers are placed in explored lands to generate gold revenue. When combinations of terrain are occupied, towns and cities can be built. Meanwhile gold is used in the Old World to buy items to benefit further New World development or to accumulate the victory points generated by Culture, Science, Religion and War which themselves are meshed with what is taking place in the three New Worlds.

This is a tightly knit puzzle that will have players pondering a multiplicity of decisions from start to finish. As much of the play is simultaneous and "single-action", there is little downtime. The game has a good sense of growth worthy of its fascinating theme.
181382.name: Niña & Pinta
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 95 -- There Were Guys Before Napoleon

181383.description:
A game published about the German City of Hamm.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Hamm. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.
181383.name: Leben in Hamm

181384.name: Cave of the Cybersteed
181384.description:
From the rear cover:

In the quiet and unsuspecting village of Ek-Wyne, the residents go about their daily and mundane tasks not realizing that a terror from above has come to call. One by one the frightened mutant inhabitants disappear in a flash of light. Will those who remain pick up the pieces and carry on or will they seek out and discover who or what is behind this sinister act?

Enter the Cave of the Cybersteed

An Adventure for 4-6 players.

181385.description: Retro Loonacy is a rapid fire card game in which players race to be the first to empty their hand by matching one of two images on each card in their hand with the images on the open piles in front of them. The number of piles varies depending on the number of players, and if players ever reach a moment in which no one can play, everyone draws a card and it adds it to their hand at the same time, then the game play resumes.
181385.name: Retro Loonacy

181386.name: Forever Lost: Episode 1
181386.description:
Awaking in a mind you don’t know to a world you can’t remember. Surrounded by things that can’t be real, haunted by experiences long forgotten.

Questions racing through your mind. Is this a waking nightmare or a half-forgotten dream? Who are you? Where are you? How long have you been here and how do you escape?

The answers are somewhere, but where? In the world you have found yourself trapped in or your own mind?

You have to move on, you have to discover the truth. You have to escape!

Source: The Developer Website.

181387.name: Forever Lost: Episode 2
181387.description:
Congratulations! You managed to escape from that … what was it? A hospital, a lunatic asylum? No it was something else, was it … staged? Who built it? Who put you there?

None of that matters right now, you must keep moving! No time to catch your breath, you just have to keep going! Have you won your freedom or are you just in another cage? Were you ever free before this whole … whatever this is … started?

Explore what awaits in front of you and learn all you can about what you left behind.

Welcome … to Episode 2.

Source: The Developer Website.

181388.name: Forever Lost: Episode 3
181388.description:
Founded in 1806, the Hawthorne Asylum was active during a time when patients were treated less like people and more like lab rats.

Although closed down in the 50’s due to changing ethical standards it is said that experiments were still being conducted for decades to come.

This is the concluding episode to the Forever Lost story, if you haven’t played the previous two episodes then please go do that now, we can objectively say they’re awesome.

A first person point and click game filled with puzzles, objects, rooms, and more puzzles. Plus there’s an actual story for those players that way inclined.

Source: The Developer Website.

181389.name: Cabin Escape: Alice's Story
181389.description:
From the creators of Forever Lost which has had over 1 million downloads worldwide!

Help Alice escape the isolated log cabin by discovering clues and solving puzzles.

Cabin Escape is a prologue to the Forever Lost series but don’t worry, you don’t need to play either game to appreciate the other. They will both compliment each other nicely though so it is encouraged.

Source: The Developer Website.

181390.name: Buttons
181390.description:
Buttons is a clever dice game with a press-your-luck element. The players take turns rolling the dice and placing buttons on their board. Although only one person rolls the dice at a time, everyone can profit from the dice roll and also place a button. But be careful! The fuller the board, the riskier it becomes to play. Then it's a case of getting out in time so as not to lose your buttons!

Buttons is played over several rounds. In every round, the goal of the players is to place buttons on the spaces. At the end of a round, players score for the buttons they've placed; each set of three gives them a star, which is placed on the player board. The first player to have either twelve stars or five stars in a row wins!

181391.name: Zoneplex: Evocation
181391.description:
Evocation refines and streamlines 3-5 player game play and adds a 1-2 player challenge mode!
Evocation comes with 11 new game-tiles and downloadable original soundtrack.

181392.name: HλLF-LIFE 3
181392.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




User Summary

HλLF-LIFE 3 is the next game in the series. When or if the game will be released is unknown.

181393.description:
Brass Empire takes place in a Steampunk universe and each player takes on the role of a different corporation hiring the best employees, constructing building, and manufacturing steam-powered machines. Players battle and sabotage each other to amass economic wealth and influence to win the game.

Overview:

Welcome to the Steampunk world of Cobalt. For centuries, Cobalt has been ruled by corporations seeking to enhance their wealth and influence with Brass. Brass doesn’t just fuel the economy but literally fuels the technology and transportation of the world through its unique thermodynamic properties. Every day these companies compete and battle to expand their territory and authority. Companies work to optimize their labor force and resources to mine the most Brass in each territory through corporate espionage, technology, security, and even sabotage. You work for such a company and have been tasked with expanding into a new region by constructing new corporate buildings, hiring employees, and battling other companies in the area. The player who earns the most Brass will lead his company to victory in the region.

Each turn, you will play Employee cards from your hand to gain resources. These resources will allow you to acquire new Employees, Buildings and Units for your deck. Along the way, you will acquire buildings to enhance your hold on the region and command units to attack other companies and mine for Brass. At the end of the game, the player with the most Brass is the winner.
181393.name: Brass Empire
boardgamepodcastepisode: GrogCast Season 2, Episode 6
Strange Assembly 192 - Live From GenCon 2016

181394.name: his & hers
181394.description: A trivia game where a team of men play against a team of women. A spinner shows whether the current team will answer a "his", "hers", or "his & hers" question, or do a "his & hers" challenge. A team correctly answering a question about the opposite sex, get more points than for questions about their own. Challenges have both teams competing to see who can list more items for the category given.

181396.name: The King of Joseon
181396.description:
The King of Joseon reenacts the tragic story of the boy king Danjong, who ascended the throne at the age of twelve but was shortly dethroned by his uncle, Grand Prince Sooyang. The game is set on the year 1452, when some remained loyal to the king while others took the side of the ambitious usurper. Which side are you on? And who will prevail?

There are 32 cards that represent various characters. Most of the cards have numeric values on them: 1 King; 1 Grand Prince [0]; 4 Bandits; 2 Queens [9]; 2 Ministers [8]; 2 Councilors [7]; 2 Generals [6]; 2 Eunuchs [5]; 2 Ambassadors [4]; 6 Prefects [3]; 6 Policemen [2]; and 2 Clowns [1].

At the beginning of the game, all cards are dealt to the players. (In a 3-player game, the dealer receives one less.) The player with the Grand Prince reveals it. On his/her turn, the player can either (1) play a set of two identical cards and use its special ability or (2) attempt to steal a card from another player.

If a player revealed the Grand Prince, his/her winning condition is to have the King and three cards out of the Queens, Ministers, and Councilors. For other players, the winning condition is to have the King card only (and nothing else) in his/her hand.

The overall flow is simple enough, but the special powers of the cards make the game more tactical than it appears.

181397.name: Bugz
181397.description:
In Bugz, there are ants, beetles and mosquitoes; there are red bugs, green bugs and blue bugs; there are hollow bugs, spotty bugs and solid bugs; and there are small bugs, medium bugs and large bugs. In the game, players take it in turns to try and collect as many bugs as they can – but in order to score points, all the bugs they pick up in a single turn must have at least one feature in common.

To play the game, 20 cards are laid out face-down in a grid. Player 1 then begins the game by turning up 2 cards in place. If these cards share a feature, he can either end his turn and score these, or keep going by turning up another card. If all 3 cards share a feature, once again, he can either end his turn and score these, or keep going, and so on.

The more bugs a player collects in a single turn, the more points he will get. But if at any point the cards he has turned up don’t all share a feature, he must turn them back over and won’t score any points at all.

Players continue taking turns until the grid can no longer be refilled to 20 cards, whereupon the game is over, and the player with the most points is the winner.

181400.description:
With a census-estimated population of 7.8M in 2014, Long Island is the most populated island in any U.S. state or territory. It is also the longest and largest island in the contiguous United States extending 118 miles from New York Harbor to Montauk Point. However, it's maximum north-south distance is only 23 miles.

The Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) is the busiest commuter railroad system in North America, carrying an average of 338K passengers each weekday. Chartered in 1834, it is also the oldest railroad still operating under its original name. It is also the only railroad that operates 24/7 with significant off peak, weekend and holiday service.

In Age of Steam: Long Island, players will be climbing all over each other as they struggle to be the first to get passengers to their destinations.

Significant differences:


Designed for 2-3 players, w/ few cubes and a lot of opportunities for blocking.
Each round, each player can deliver at most one passenger East and one passenger West.
Once-around auction for player order.
Locomotive/Urbanization alternate being available with only 1 (two-player) or 2 (three-player) other actions being available at all.
The Early Riser action (three-player only) bundles First Build, First Move, and Locomotive into one but restricts the player to one delivery.
181400.name: Age of Steam: Long Island

181401.description:
Players build a new version of the world in the Chronicles Series, starting with the first game: Chronicles 1: Origins. First, players take the role of leaders of a small and emerging tribe in the early Stone Age, collaborating to avoid threats, exploit opportunities, and build the tribe to a position of growth and stability. Then, once a variety of tribes have been created, players take leadership of a city-state that evolved from an original tribe and contest the region with their opponents who are the leaders of city-states of their own. Using Legacy mechanisms, the world evolves as the city-states use exploration, conquest, culture, and religion to out-compete their opponents and try to establish the most enduring enterprise. Not every tribe created in this game will survive to the next...

Each game in the Chronicles Series uses Rob Daviau's Legacy System within the game itself, but will use the new Echo System to allow the world you create in Chronicles 1: Origins to be continued in the second game of the Chronicles Series due out in 2017.
181401.name: Chronicles 1: Origins
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
BGA Ep 82 - GenCon Surprises!
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Episode 10: The one about 2016 and 2017
Episode 12 - Rob Daviau Interview
Episode 15 - Get Hype! Most anticipated games of 2017 with Jack and John

181402.name: Rugged Kingdom
181402.description:
Rugged Kingdom tells the tale of an adventurer drifting through life, never knowing where he came from or who he really is. With the sudden disappearance of all of the world's heroes, the world begins to fall into shadow. Now our unlikely hero stands as the last hope to overcome the great evil. Can he obtain the courage to dispel the great evil, and in doing so find out who he is? Or will he fail, and see the world he loved descend into chaos?

The world of the Rugged Kingdom compromises a variety of landscapes, each inhabited by different races, human, elf, dwarf, and orc. As you play through the game and travel to the various locations, you will see the differences in terrain and architecture favoured by the different races.

Source: The Developer Website.

181403.description: Adds a new crew type (Thrifty Engineer) and treasure type (Scrap Metal) to the game.
181403.name: Captain's Wager: Kickstarter Promos

181404.description:
It is Saint-Averna's day, the holiest day in the kingdom of Averna. To celebrate, all the citizens gather in the capital city to party, drink and sing, from tavern to tavern. In the interactive card-driven worker placement game Taverna, you play an innkeeper of the city, eager to profit from this celebration and make his renown widespread. In order to do so, you will need to get along well with the four peoples of the kingdom, and you will need to cope with the demands of the Royal Court. It is up to you to be courteous with all of them. Will you play fair? Or will you use trickery, magic, and your influence with the most famous dignitaries?

Each turn, players will chose one customer among the four available cards and place it in one of the five taverns. The property owners receive gold and the innkeeper is rewarded if he fulfils the expectations of the patrons. During your turn you can play one of the four dignitaries, cast spells, use royal favours and benefit from privileges. At the end of turn six, players will score one of the five members of the Royal Court, each scoring being available once. Your popularity with the four people will determine the royal scoring order and final bonuses. Power and glory to the most popular innkeeper.
181404.name: Taverna
boardgamepodcastepisode: Low Player Count - Ep 16 - It's BGGcon Y'all!
The Game Pit: Episode 51 - Treasure Hunt Essen 2015 Part 3

181406.name: Sexual Pursuit
181406.description:
A clone of Trivial Pursuit.

Players start in the center of the hex shaped board, the "Erogenous Center". In turn, they roll a die and move that number of spaces down one of the six radial tracks where they will land on either "Subject Position" or "Capital Position" spaces. The "Dealer" (an opponent, or partner in team games) draws a card and, based on the symbol on the space, asks a sexual trivia question. If answered correctly the player rolls and moves again. If incorrect play passes to next player. If players correctly answer a question while on one of the six outside Capital Zone spaces they get a plastic ring ("Stage Pieces") they can place on their spindle shaped game pawn. If they land on an "Erogenous Zone" space they are asked a question from a card but instead of being right or wrong the answer has to satisfy their Dealer. Once they have all six rings from the outside Capital Zones they move towards the center Erogenous Center space and try to answer an Erogenous Zone question there. If their answer satisfies the Dealer, they win. If not, they must leave the Erogenous Center on the next turn and return again.

181407.name: Half-Orc Feats
181407.description: Half-Orc Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to the most hardcore death-dealers of the humanoid races, the hard-charging half-orcs. Often dismissed as simple savages, half-orc heroes learn to channel the latent lethality and bloodlust of their monstrous parentage to achieve amazing feats of tenacious audacity. This product contains 14 mythic feats for your half-pint heroes that may be short on stature but long on courage, from Blood Vengeance and Resilient Brute to Ferocious Summons, Surprise Follow-Through, and Thrill of the Kill!

181408.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 479 - Aug 2015)
181408.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 479 - August 2015
Cover by Laurel Almstedt

Theme: Superstitions

181410.name: Beresteczko 1651
181410.description:
Game covers biggest land battle of XVII century, fought between the Ukrainian Cossacks, led by Hetman Bohdan Khmelnytsky, aided by their Crimean Tatar allies, and a Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth army under King John II Casimir. It was a battle of a Cossack rebellion in Ukraine that took place in the years 1648–1657.
Game uses Husaria system, designed for XVII century battles.

181411.name: Templarmech Inquisition
181411.description:
Templarmech Inquisition takes place in a future where Templarmechs, Cybersamurai, TechnoVikings, and Gamma/Meta/Star Romans go to war.

The game is played with units (cards) arranged in ranks. Player can command units to mobilize (move) or activate to perform various actions. Players decide on their commands in secret and preform them simultaneously. Players can use honor to bring more units into play.

181412.name: AFL DVD Triva Challenge
181412.description:
"DVD Bonus Extra DVD 500 New Action Film AFL Trivia Questions For The 2007 Season 2 DVD Extra Bonus DVD"

AFL DVD Challenge is the Trivia Game for the whole family.
Prove what you have known all along. That when it comes to matters AFL you've always been right.

Official AFL Trivia Challenge has over 1000 questions and answers presented on DVD with exciting action shots from the greatest game in the world.

181413.description: Come sail away to the magical island offered in Krosmaster: Arena – Piwate Island, an expansion for Krosmaster: Arena that includes a new double-sided board, a single figure, and punch board. Rules for the new island are also included.
181413.name: Krosmaster: Arena – Piwate Island

181414.name: Molon Labe
181414.description:
This game is an exciting family war-game.
Atmospheric, beautifully executed game.

Very simple rules.
The aim of the game is to capture (to destroy) towers of opponents and to save own. You have 4 generals, which you can develop.
The peculiarity is that to win you have to capture at least one tower of each opponent.

The objective of the game is as follows: the value of the cube + the overall level of a General (1....4) + 1 (if you are near the tower) + the value of the coin of reinforcements.

As in real war, the victory happens with a genius commander + luck!!

181415.name: Don't be Greedy
181415.description: Push your luck game for kids by Melissa and Doug. Players take turns drawing jewels from a bag to put in their treasure chests. If they draw a frown they have to put their treasure back in the bag.

181416.name: Hellfrost Matters of Faith
181416.description:
[Taken from the site description.]
While the denizens of the frozen north are divided by race and culture, the pantheon of 24 major gods is a universal concept. Though forbidden from direct interference, the gods are not removed from the world, making their presence felt through their paladins and priests, divine heralds, and natural events.

Whether they pay lip service to many gods, attend infrequent ceremonies, have chosen a patron deity, have devoted their life without holy vows, or have taken vows as a member of the clergy, all citizens honor the gods in some way. To deny the gods is to deny reality.

Within this book you will find:

Expanded information on the clergy of the 24 major cults.
Details concerning over 90 major and 70 local festivals, any of which can be used as the backdrop to an adventure or to make the heroes’ day more interesting.
Information on 12 major inhuman deities.
A tour of Godsheim, the realm of the gods, and the celestial sphere.
An overview of the Abyss, including the Arcane Background (Demonist) and a sample of notable demon lords.




This book is designed for use in conjunction with the Hellfrost Player’s Guide.

181417.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2015 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This is a specially made ethical dilemma card for the game, to be added to the base game. This card does not replace any of the ethical dilemma that come with the game.

The card is compatible with first and second printing versions of Euphoria.
181417.name: Euphoria: Participate In The Game or Watch It Played

boardgamepublisher: Greater Than Games (Dice Hate Me Games)
181418.description:
A promotional card given out during the 2015 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This promo introduces the new Pitcher card 'Pep Budgie' with the card number #P9.
181418.name: Bottom of the 9th: Pep Budgie

181419.name: Anduin (Issue 59 - Jan 2000)
rpgissuearticle: Die Abenteuer von Bruno dem Banditen
181419.description:
Anduin Fanzine
Issue 59 - January 2000
Cover art by Yoshi

"Spacerun" adaptation of Shadowrun

181420.name: BeeKeeper
181420.description:
INTRO:
Beekeeper is a family friendly game for children and adults to enjoy. The game consists of 37 Hexagonal Playing Pieces, 1 set of instructions and a nice Black Cloth Pouch w/ drawstrings to hold all the pieces! Set-up time is approx. 2-3 minutes with playtime amounting to 5-10 minutes, and this game can be played with up to 6 players.
GAMEPLAY:
1st) dump out the hexagonal pieces onto your playing surface and find the queen chit (she has an image on each side of the chit so it should be easy to find her).
2nd)Place the queen in the middle of the playing surface.
3rd)Arrange the rest of the pieces (beekeeper logo side facing up) around the queen piece until you have 3 rows around the queen. (The playing surface should resemble a giant hexagonal shape, or honeycomb)
4th) Youngest player gets to go first by pulling 1 chit from the game (*NOTE* only pieces with 3 open sides can be removed from the arranged pieces). He/She will then flip over the piece and find the following;
BEE POINTS: These give you points to win the game
ANIMALS: These guys make you lose turns
HONEY TOKENS: You need at least 6 honey tokens to pull the queen from her throne when she has at least 3 open sides and end the game and with her you get 10 bee points.
BEE NET or HONEY EXTRACTOR: Use these cards once during gameplay to steal a bee chit or honey chit from an opposing player (once used they must be discarded to the side)
Once the first player's turn is complete, then the person to the left is next to pull a piece from the hive.

ENDING AND WINNING THE GAME:
The game is ended when the Queen chit is removed from the playing surface, which can happen two ways;
One way is if she has at least 3 open sides and someone has 6 or more HONEY TOKENS.
The other way is if there are no more chits to pull from the game, then the queen is rewarded to the next player's turn.
The game is won by the person with the most Bee Points, so count up all of your drones', larvas', workers' and queen bee's chit values and that will be your Bee Point count.

Norshanks Game Cause:
As with most of the games that Norshanks Games will be marketing, this game is tied to Beekeeping Associations in various countries, and every time a game is sold, part of the profits will be donated to the Purchaser's Current Country of Residence National Beekeeping Association.
The donated funds will go to the Beekeeping Associations to help save the bees by; researching colony collapse disorder, increasing bee populations, educating the public about the importance of bees, and many other great projects!
With your help we can help reverse the collapse of bee populations everywhere!

Game is expected to be ready for shipment in Winter.

181421.name: Star Wars: Duell der Mächte
181421.description:
A simple Star Wars themed Card game.
Each turn a villain card is revealed and players use their 8 hero cards to bid on them. Different villains give different points; Darth Vader, however, gives negative points.

181422.name: Miseries and Misfortunes
181422.description:
Publisher blurb:

Miseries and Misfortunes is a 54-page supplement for Basic Dungeons & Dragons. It contains six new classes, as well as weapons, spells and equipment for playing D&D in the first half of the 17th century. Rules describe fighting with rapier, pistol, pike and musket in small formations, hiring servants and exploring strange and forgotten places.

181423.description: This expansion for Cards Against Humanity has got 30 cards fully-illustrated by some of the best graphic designers in the world, including Milton Glaser (I ♥ NY), Susan Kare (the Apple Macintosh), Jessica Hische (Daily Drop Cap), and legendary printmakers including Jay Ryan, Yann Legendre, Olly Moss, Mike Mitchell, Paul Octavious, and Sonnenzimmer.
181423.name: Cards Against Humanity: Design Pack

181424.name: Words on my Mind
181424.description:
"Shake and toss the dice! Race against the clock to create the most words using the letters rolled. Now you have words on your mind!"

Words on my Mind is a word dice game in which players roll lettered dice and then all use the same dice to form as many words as possible in the time allowed, in almost a simplified Boggle-style game.

181425.name: Sharpe Initiatives: Earthgouger
181425.description:
From the publisher's website:

A thrillride of an adventure for 3rd or 4th level heroes, designed to be played in one or two sessions. If you play Robin D. Laws’ The Strangling Sea at first level you can use Sharpe Initiatives as a callback to events earlier in the PCs’ careers; but this adventure is designed to bulldoze itself into any campaign in which dwarves aspire to re-engineer the broken underworld.

181426.name: Devouring Shadow
181426.description:
Publisher blurb:

Legends say that there is something both horrible and hungry that lives in the mountain peaks. Those who have seen it and escaped suggest that its body remains unseen, although its shadow suggests a carrion bird of great size and two heads. Most who have seen it, however, have not lived to tell that tale.

Mountain Terrors: Devouring Shadow is a bestiary PDF for the Chronicle System, the rules engine that powers our popular A Song of Ice & Fire Roleplaying game.

181428.name: Player's Guide to the World of Xoth
181428.description:
From the Cover

"Venture in the footsteps of Conan the Cimmerian, Satampra Zeiros of Uzuldaroum, Imaro of Nyumbani, and other fabled thieves, reavers and slayers!

Enter the City of Stone and slay the high priest of Jul-Juggah! Plunder the ancient gold of Namthu! Seek the fabled jewel of Khadim Bey, but beware the nameless horrors of the Al-Khazi desert! Fight the dread adepts of the ape-god, or succumb to the pleasures of the Moon-Juice of Yaatana! Or perhaps you will perish by the curses of Ur-Kharra, the long-dead sorcerer-king of Elder Kuth?"

181429.description: Five-Minute Delivery is a game where players take on the role of bundle deliverers in the goblin town of Goobliopolis. On a randomly constructed board, players listen to directions from the narrator on an MP3 as they try to deliver bundles to various locations. The locations are determined by Address Cards each player gets, and the routes are different based on the layout of the tiles that make up the town. Because the length of the game is determined by the MP3's that work with the game, it takes... five minutes to play. (The title seems obvious now, doesn’t it?) The game is played in real time (meaning everybody plays at the same time with no turns). A variety of MP3’s give players different directions and (along with the random town layout) different play experiences every time.
181429.name: Five Minute Delivery: Hamlet #1 (Slurgo)

181432.name: Chat Game
181432.description:
A party game with cards of three categories: Description of words, Pantomime, Lists

Split into two teams! The more the better! Make sounds, pantomime or anyhting you can to describe the most words to your teammates!

181433.description:
The first of two bonus tilesets created for the Clockwork Wars Kickstarter. This expansion consists of four new tiles:


Two Academy tiles, which are used to generate additional workers.
Two Volcano tiles, which erupt and cause chaos and destruction.


Also included is a double-sided reference card (thick cardboard stock) with all necessary rules.
181433.name: Clockwork Wars: Academy & Volcano Bonus Tiles

181434.description:
The second of two bonus tilesets created for the Clockwork Wars Kickstarter. This expansion consists of four new tiles:


Two Gulag tiles, which are used to capture and remove enemy soldiers.
Two Dynamo tiles, which provide potent scoring opportunities.


Also included is a double-sided reference card (thick cardboard stock) with all necessary rules.
181434.name: Clockwork Wars: Gulag & Dynamo Bonus Tiles

181435.name: Battle Mania Daiginjou
181435.description:
User Summary

A horizontal shoot em up game staring two women that use jetpacks to fight their enemies. The art is done in an anime style and the story a parody of the genre. You control your character, her partner, and a drone, with the options menu allowing you to change the way that you and your companions shoot. Your partner can change from shooting forward or backwards at the press of a button, the drone can be made to shoot in different directions, and you can limit yourself to firing forward, the direction your partner is currently firing, or you can allow yourself to fire in eight directions. Before each stage, you are able to select between five different jetpacks that each have a unique charge attack that you can use.

181436.name: Mech Arena
181436.description:
Mech Arena is a tactical card game where you pilot giant Mechs in gladiatorial combat. Where your goal is to defeat your opponents by shooting, hacking and kicking their Mechs to bits. An easy task, save for the fact they are trying to do the same to you. Equal parts MMA and demolition derby it is no wonder Mech Arena is the sport of choice for all citizens of the twenty third Century.

To get started build your Mech Deck from a variety of System, Chassis and Pilot microdecks. Then combat each other in a turn based battle on the arena game board. The battles are quick pace and every draw and play of the card counts because when your deck is depleted you are out of the game.

181437.name: The Sword of Selfaril
181437.description:
From the Front Cover:

The fabled Sword of Selfaril is told to bestow wisdom and power upon whomever wields it, so naturally its discovery has caused quite a stir in Mulmaster. All of this is complicated when a masked benefactor claims to not only know the truth about the blade, but also how it can be used to benefit the oppressed people of Mulmaster. Can it truly change Mulmaster for the better? A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to The Sword of Selfaril, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 5th-10th level characters, and is optimized for five 8th-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms, in the city of Mulmaster.

181438.name: Black Heart of Vengeance
181438.description:
From the Front Cover:

Aleyd Burral, the Risen Hero of Phlan has sounded the call to battle! Intent on retaking her home of Phlan, Aleyd has amassed a surprising amount of support from the citizenry of Phlan, including that of the High Blade himself. But as lofty as her goals might be, the honor-bound warrior seems willing to sacrifice much in her quest—including everything she once stood for. A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Black Heart of Vengeance, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 5th-10th level characters, and is optimized for five 8th-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms, in the city of Mulmaster.

181439.name: Boltsmelter's Book
181439.description:
From the Front Cover:

A dwarven expedition has stopped in Mulmaster for much-needed supplies. Furgis Boltsmelter, their founder and leader,
is looking for some "no questions asked" protection for the duration of his stay in the city. Whatever he is trying to protect may not stay hidden for long. Can you keep his secret treasure out of the wrong hands? A four-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Boltsmelter’s Book, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 2nd-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. A player with an ineligible character can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms, in and around the city of Mulmaster and the Flooded Forest to the south of the city.

181440.description:
1:34 a.m. --- A fired bookkeeper’s message on Twitter: 3-SAME or SUM-15.
1:39 a.m. --- The information leaked out few minutes ago, and already the cartel chief's server has been attacked.
The stake is high, therefore the hackers not only have to break the firewall but to fight against each other ...

Hack Trick is a game of deduction and combinations where players generate numbers to finally obtain a valid password - a three-digit code with the same digits (ex. 222, 555) or with their sum being 15 (ex. 852, 159, 357). Each time a card is played, the player adds a number to the sequence, and marks the generated number - the sum of the last two numbers - on the keypad (places a marker on the key). Because the keypad is a magic square (the sum of each row, column or diagonal is 15) the object of the game is to line up three markers or place three on the same key.

Hack Trick gameplay is deceptively simple, but you’ll see, that it hides many combinations. In his turn, the player may ask the sum of the opponent’s hand, than play a card or draw. When he plays a card he may capture opponent markers, moreover, he may sacrifice a marker to force his opponent to play a card in the next turn, or contrarily, protect himself from being forced. Markers can be used in five different ways, but be careful, the player who runs out loses!

Finally, the winner will be the player who knows how to defend and attack the positions, when to gather information, when to use the doubles, when to start a forced series, but above all how to find the right balance between forming a strong hand and tend to the final goal on the board.
181440.name: Hack Trick
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 004 – Essen 2015 Diary!
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 017 – Our Podcast Subscriptions

181441.name: Litterateur
181441.description:
Litterateur is a card-drafting and word-building game for up to five players.

For five rounds, players will draft cards into their hands and use these cards, along with three common cards, to produce a word. the player with the best word will get to choose any three cards in play to put into their score pile. The player in second place will get two cards and players in third and fourth place will get one card each.

In the sixth round, players will use these previously scored cards to produce a final word. The player with the best word in this final round wins the game.

To win, players must draft wisely at the beginning and end of each round.

181442.name: Nipponzenkoku Mikenekotomato-no-Haitatsuyasan
181442.description:
Part of Bandai's Party Joy series of lighter boardgames. (#27)

This game about home delivery in Japan.

The players draw luggage card, load them on their trucks and gain victory points when the deliver them at their destination. However, the destinations are not easily found. Moreover, there is a deadline, depending on the type of luggage, and players receive no points when they are to late.
In addition, when a player catches up with a truck of another player, he make take some of his luggage.

It became stereotypical pick-and-deliver game, published in Japan about three years earlier than Auf Achse.

Already out of print.

181443.name: Hill Street Blues
181443.description:
Hill Street Blues "The most honoured series in the history of television", World wide it has achieved 59 awards that include 26 Emmy's.
Krisalis have created a computer controlled city which generates an environment displaying 300 vehicles and 400 people who live and work within the Hill Street Precinct for you to interact with.
You take the roll of Captain Furillo and by deploying the Police Officers under your control, you solve and control the crime rate, which the computer generates. The game features nine of the most famous characters from the series using these Police Officers, you can interact with up to nine crime incidents simultaneously, ranging from Muggers to Bank Robbery, Drug Pushers to Murderers. So "Remember, lets be careful out there!"

Source: Box back

181444.name: Mushroom Hunting
181444.description:
Cory and his friends embark on a bold quest to help their friend Dendry, a baby walking tree in need of nourishment! Help them search for nutrient-rich mushrooms in the ancestral Monkey Village, the lush Carrot Hills, and the sunlit Wavy Woods. Collect the mushrooms quickly, for dangerous animals lurk about, and their ailing friend awaits their safe return!

- Story-based action, adventure, and a whack-a-mole style arcade game all in one!
- 3 stages and 36 levels of increasing difficulty and complexity
- Original, imaginative characters
- Beautiful graphics and creative design
- Magical power-ups that you can exchange for mushrooms either earned in game-play or bought in the store

Source: The Publisher Website.

181445.description:
2 different cards from the Abacus "Katalog-Edition 16" from their catalogue 2015.

The "Signalfeuer" (signal fire) cards can be used as alternative starting cards and start with a meeple (= scout) added. Game play runs as usual and ends until 4x4 cards have been played.
For scoring a scout on a "Signalfeuer" creates a straight viewing line from tower to tower to tower and so on. Each Tower scores one point.
181445.name: Limes: Startkarten Signalfeuer

181451.name: Play Dirty 15th Anniversary Edition
181451.description:
From the Back of the Book

Fifteen years ago, John Wick's monthly game master advice column in Pyramid changed game master advice columns forever. Seen by some as revolutionary and dismissed by others as outright dangerous, it received more 5-Star Ratings and more 1-Star Ratings than any other column in the magazine's history.

This 15th Anniversary Edition not only collects all the original columns, but also adds new introductions, new illustrations, and even more of what you come to expect from Play Dirty; the most despicable, dastardly, and downright villainous game mastering tricks, traps, and tactics that will make your players love to hate you!

181453.description:
publisher blurb

This set of premium resources contains:
25 brass bullets
15 silver bullets
9 arrows

This set of wood tokens is meant to replace and upgrade the cardboard tokens included in the base game.


the kit contains 49 pieces
181453.name: Bang! The Dice Game Resource Upgrade Kit

181454.description:
publisher blurb

These are the Character Meeples for each of the heroes and epic foes in Tiny Epic Defenders by Gamelyn Games


this is a set of 23 Meeples containing

16 Heroes
8 Epic Foes
181454.name: Tiny Epic Defenders: Set of Character Meeples (Heroes & Foes)

181455.description:
this is a set of 112 total meeples

user summary

These are the Character Meeples for each of the factions in Tiny Epic Kingdoms by Gamelyn Games. This set replaces the meeples from the base game with high quality, painted Meeples.

publisher blurb

This set contains 7 Character Meeples for each of the 16 factions in Tiny Epic Kingdoms by Gamelyn Games. We do not have very many of these sets left after the Kickstarter orders that caused such a fine upgrade kit to exist, so don't delay!

See close-up photos of each character: Humans, Orcs, Elves, Dwarves, Constructs, Satyrs, Lizardfolk, Dark Elves, Centaurs, Valkyries, Goblins, Merfolk, Undead, Halflings, Shapeshifters, and Order of Gamelyn.

from a merged entry
Tiny Epic Kingdoms comes with 7 meeples in five different player colors (black, white, blue, orange, and purple). These character meeples are larger than those included with the game (approximately 19 mm tall) and are intended to be used in place of the meeples that come in the game box.

Character meeples exist for each of the original 16 factions:
- Human
- Orc
- Elf
- Dwarf
- Construct
- Satyr
- Halfling
- Lizardfolk
- Undead
- Goblin
- Valkyrie
- Dark Elf
- Merfolk
- Centaur
- Shapeshifter
- Order of Gamelyn

Certain variants exist which allow play with just a single character meeple. In such cases, the regular meeples included with Tiny Epic Kingdoms are still used.
181455.name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms Complete Set of Character Meeples (112 pcs)

181456.description:
into the woods is a forest walk simulator.

Find your way through the forest, enjoy the scenery, or - dare to explore the forest in the rising mist.. will you be able to find your way home?

The game uses unique semi transparent tiles to create a three dimensional landscape drawing for the player to explore - and get lost in.

To win the game you have to reach the other end of the forest,
fulfill a task on your way (like climbing the highest mountain),
and finally return home safely.

But beware of the fog: The longer your expediton takes, the foggier it gets - and getting stuck in the mist means losing the game...
181456.name: into the woods

181457.name: First Touch Soccer 2014
181457.description:
First Touch Soccer 2014 is the latest in the critically acclaimed series, with stunning new visuals and a brand new ‘Manager Mode’. Manage over 180 club teams spread over 30 individual competitions! Manager Mode lets you prove yourself off the pitch as well as on it. Strengthen your squad by signing new players, renewing player contracts and coaching your team.

First Touch Soccer 2014 also features an all new intuitive control mode designed from the ground up for touch. Pass and shoot towards goal with a series of taps and swipes, giving you instant satisfaction when delivering defence splitting passes and top corner shots!

Source: The Developer Website.

181458.description: Ancient evil awakens in the lands beyond the Wall. The last Targaryens bind their future to the Dothraki lord, Khal Drogo. From the heights of the Eyrie in the east to the heart of Casterly Rock in the west, the Great Houses of Westeros plot to increase their own power. Now, you can continue to follow the events of A Game of Thrones in The Road to Winterfell, the second Chapter Pack in the Westeros cycle! Like the other packs in this cycle, The Road to Winterfell is filled with iconic characters and locations from the first book in A Song of Ice and Fire. Here, you’ll meet iconic characters like Rakharo and Syrio Forel, and you’ll find a Targaryen attachment so powerful, it’s limited to one copy per deck! The Road to Winterfell also quickly expands the number of available plots with two new neutral plots and one plot loyal to House Lannister.
181458.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – The Road to Winterfell
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire
boardgamepodcastepisode: THe Good, The Board and The By Ourselves: Episode 57 “Solo Games”

181459.name: Fresh Tracks Snowboarding
181459.description:
Fresh Tracks Snowboarding is a fast-paced extreme sports simulation, combining console quality graphics & physics with arcade style game play. Compete in a series of freestyle, race & trick-race events across an international stage. Have you got what it takes to win the Prestige Tour?

Source: The Developer Website.

181460.name: Score! World Goals
181460.description:
Have you got what it takes to score the match winning goal? Recreate your favourite goals in this unique football based puzzle game. Football fan or not, this app will keep you entertained for hours!

Source: The Developer Website.

181461.name: Beehive
181461.description:
User summary:
This is an arithmetic puzzle game in which addition is the key to victory! Ten pieces inscribed with the numbers 1 to 10 are placed on the board and the person with the higher number left over at the end is the winner. If one player runs out of legal moves and cannot place a piece during the game, he loses.

Pieces are placed next to one another on the board. To place a piece next to a single other piece on the board, a player must place a piece with a higher number (whether even or odd). To place a piece next to two or more other pieces on the board, a player must place a piece a piece with the same number as the first digit of the sum of the pieces already on the board.

The game demands that players do a lot of addition to find the pieces that can be placed and to understand the strategy behind it.

Publisher's summary:
足し算ガ決め手の算数パズル的ゲームです。
数字1～10が書かれたの10個の駒をボードに配置して最後に残った駒の数
が大きい方が勝ちとなります。ただし途中で合法手が無く置けなければ負け
となります。
ボード上の駒に接するように配置して、接した駒が1個ならそれより
も大きな数字（偶数奇数の区別有り）、2個以上なら接した駒の合計数の一の
位と同じ数字の駒が置けます。
配置出来る駒を見つけゲームの戦略を考えるには一度に沢山の足し算が必要なゲームです。

Not to be confused with Beehive

181462.name: Pyramid (Volume 3, Issue 81 - Jul 2015)
181462.description:
Creepy Creations for Countless Campaigns!

Ghoulish things come in small packages. They can also emerge from vats . . . or lurk at crossroads, awaiting the curious. This month's Pyramid - the PDF magazine for roleplayers - checks out the tangibly terrifying, for a suitably scary assortment of situations. Its frightening features include:


"Iraqi Irruptor Blues," an adventure for GURPS Horror: The Madness Dossier, as told by GURPS guru Jason "PK" Levine. Try to find teammates who have been erased from existence, while fighting against monsters setting loose deadly memes, all in pursuit of a boxful of something . . .
"Too Similar, Too Different," an in-depth examination of human hybrids from GURPS Locations: St. George's Cathedral author Michele Armellini. Learn how to create these walking (or oozing) nightmares, what GURPS characteristics are most appropriate, and four templates of possible monstrosities.
"Hellblade," this month's Eidetic Memory offering from GURPS Banestorm: Abydos author David L. Pulver. Discover a tempting weapon that can trap the souls of those it slays . . . but where it puts those spirits is an adventure unto itself. Get GURPS stats for the demonic warders, a map of the Hell-Within-the-Blade, and full details to incorporate this subplot into your fantasy or modern campaign.
"Anatomy of a Crossroads Bargain," a look at the history and roleplaying aspects of selling your soul for fun and profit. You'll also gain an understanding of appropriate GURPS traits to represent a bargain, and even "escape clauses" to come back from the brink!
"Bell, Book, and Candle," a systemless presentation of three flavorful items that can help call upon the dead - each with their own drawbacks. Incorporate them into a modern occult or monster-hunting campaign, or let them be a perilous part of any fantasy world.
"Altus Brat," a wafer that can bring someone from the dead . . . but at a terrible cost. Discover GURPS stats and rules for the results of using this strange item.


This issue also provides a Random Thought Table that explores how to make your own horrific creations. No matter whether you seek a taste of terror to add to an otherwise normal campaign, or you're running a full-fledged fright-fest, you'll get more than you bargained for with this Pyramid!

- Publisher's description

181463.name: Trodox (Issue 37 - Jul 2015)
181463.description:
Das Fanzine für neugierige & experimentierfreudige Spielinteressierte

Ars Arcana
Science Fiction-Roman: Die Grenzwelt - Teil 1

181464.description:
D6 Shooter is a fast paced western themed press your luck dice & card game for 2-4 players. Take on the roll of Bounty Hunter and gain a good reputation by hunting down & capturing wanted bandits that plague a small town. Gather enough "Rep" points to work your way from Bounty Hunter all the way to Marshall. Better hurry, you are not the only one after the job!

The game includes over 100 game cards, 10 General Store cards & 6 custom shooter dice. On each player's turn, they flip over a card to hunt for a wanted bandit. Each bandit has a sequence of suit symbols (heart, diamond, spade & club). The tougher the bandit the more suit symbols will appear. The player can roll and re-roll the 6 dice up to 3 times to try to capture the bandit by matching these symbol. Jokers are wild and can be used as any suit. Skulls, if rolled, render the die out of play. Once captured you can stop & collect the bandit by moving them into you jail, or you may press your luck & try to grab more bandits. If you decide to continue on your hunt you get to re-roll all of your dice, minus any skulls previously rolled, for three more chances to capture the new bandit. Lose any bandit on your turn & you lose ALL the bandits collected this round!

Each bandit has a reward amount for their capture as well as 1 to 2 reputation points to put towards your promotions. Higher ranks gain the ability to re-roll a certain number of skull dice.

Reward money can be traded in for General Store cards which can help you on your journey or played to hinder another player's. But choose wisely, spending your reward money will sacrifice the Rep you have gained for those bandits!

The game deck also contains event cards. Some events award you with General Store cards by completing a rolling task. Other events may cause you to lose the bandits you are wrangling, or have your previously captured bandits escape from your jail!

Be the first player to be promoted to Marshall to win!
